description.text:
DIRECTOR OF INTERNATIONAL SALES – BASED IN EUROPE
On behalf of our client, Power Technologies, we are seeking a results-driven Director of International Sales to join their team in Europe (remote position). The ideal candidate can speak either German or French (or both), and will have a demonstrated ability to set up distribution, lead channel development initiatives, manage partner relationships, and drive revenue growth through effective sales execution and team collaboration.
COMPANY OVERVIEW
Power Technologies designs and markets high-quality products that support the smart charging, network management, and security of mobile digital devices. Mobile devices are continuously evolving and transforming the workflows and operating models of every industry. Our products enable organizations to deploy critical digital tools to their teams with confidence that the devices are ready for use, resulting in increased performance and productivity. At Power Technologies, we bring technology and connection to life. Company website: https://powertechnologies.com/
POSITION OVERVIEW
Reporting to the Chief Sales & Marketing Officer, who is based in the U.S, this role is responsible for managing and expanding our international sales operations across distribution, reseller, and end-user channels within the Education and Commercial sectors (including manufacturing, logistics, and healthcare).This position includes direct management of the international sales team, providing leadership, coaching, and performance oversight to ensure alignment with international sales objectives. The Director will coordinate regional sales strategies, monitor team KPIs, and foster a high-performance culture across geographically dispersed markets. In addition, the role will oversee partner enablement, deliver ongoing training, and ensure consistent execution of go-to-market plans.This position has a requirement of having direct experience in the EdTech market, working with distributors and resellers.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Provide day-to-day leadership and direction to international sales team members, setting clear priorities, coaching for performance, and fostering a culture of accountability and collaboration in alignment with international sales goals.Translate high-level business strategy into measurable goals and KPIs, ensuring alignment across team members, partners, and internal stakeholders.Develop and execute international sales strategies and tactical plans aligned with annual revenue and profit targets, to expand distribution, reseller, and end-user partnerships, with a strong emphasis on EdTech, ICT, and commercial markets.Manage the international sales and expense budget, tracking performance monthly and adjusting tactics to stay on target.Plan and conduct regular business reviews with distribution partners, ensuring alignment on product updates, brand strategy, marketing activities, and performance metrics.Collaborate with distribution leadership and sales reps to ensure effective lead capture, deal closure, and account management that supports market share growth.Design and implement regional sales and marketing plans, tailored to international markets, to increase visibility and penetration within value-added distributor networks.Ensure the sales team and channel partners are fully trained and equipped with product knowledge, application expertise, and the ability to effectively communicate value to customers and partners.Identify and drive cross-sell and upsell opportunities within the distribution channel to maximize revenue per account.Partner with marketing teams to co-develop impactful campaigns, track ROI, and apply insights to optimize future initiatives.Manage the end-to-end order process, including reviewing WSD purchase orders and coordinating with internal teams to ensure timely fulfillment and communication.Provide weekly report of pipeline, forecast, and activities within NetSuite CRM, including but not limited to sales-driven activities and communication associated with channel partners and end users, forecast, manage, and report on ongoing sales and pipeline activity.Leverage regional data and analytics to understand international customer behavior and refine sales strategies accordingly.Identify and communicate regularly with CSMO on new business and product opportunities within international education and commercial markets, contributing to product development and innovation.Deliver compelling product demonstrations and presentations, showcasing technical knowledge and market-specific benefits of the Power Technologies product line.Represent the company at international trade shows and exhibitions, supporting brand visibility and lead generation efforts.Support the creation of tailored sales tools and presentations, enabling partners to effectively position and sell Power Technologies solutions.Coordinate cross-functionally with internal departments (Marketing, Operations, Customer Service, Finance) to ensure seamless execution of sales initiatives and customer satisfaction.Participate in building and reinforcing company culture consistent with company purpose and values.Hold self and others accountable to conduct business in a manner compliant with Power Technologies’ policies and procedures and internal controls applicable to their role.Other duties as assigned.
CANDIDATE PROFILE:
The successful candidate will bring energy, initiative, and a collaborative mindset to the role. We are looking for a confident, competitive, and goal-oriented professional with a track record of building strong partnerships, managing remote teams, and delivering measurable results. This role requires a proactive approach to business development, with a focus on expanding global channel relationships and supporting the growth of the company’s product lines in international markets.
EXPERIENCE AND REQUIREMENTS
BA, BS degree is required.5+ years related sales or experience leading multi-person, multi-region international sales teams with demonstrated ability to navigate complex reseller and distributor organizations, build distribution through Warehouse Stocking Distributors and Resellers specifically within EdTech market is required.Excellent sales skills and sales leadership capabilities; exceptionally strong negotiation and consultation skillsAbility to deliver results against sales targets, with a proven record.Proven ability to engage in middle, senior, and C-level management structures.An articulate and effective communicator with demonstrated negotiation skills across multiple services and functions.Experienced in functioning effectively in an international environment.Ability to respond and work well under pressure and change.Proactive, highly organized, and detail-oriented with the ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time effectively.Demonstrated ability to prioritize effectively, supporting multiple channel partners.Excellent presentation skillsStrong computer skills – specifically Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.CRM experience required; NetSuite experience is a bonus.Proficient in English and German, multilingual a plusAbility to travel up to 60% internationally.

internal teams to ensure timely fulfillment and communication.Provide weekly report of pipeline, forecast, and activities within NetSuite CRM, including but not limited to sales-driven activities and communication associated with channel partners and end users, forecast, manage, and report on ongoing sales and pipeline activity.Leverage regional data and analytics to understand international customer behavior and refine sales strategies accordingly.Identify and communicate regularly with CSMO on new business and product opportunities within international education and commercial markets, contributing to product development and innovation.Deliver compelling product demonstrations and presentations, showcasing technical knowledge and market-specific benefits of the Power Technologies product line.Represent the company at international trade shows and exhibitions, supporting brand visibility and lead generation efforts.Support the creation of tailored sales tools and presentations, enabling partners to effectively position and sell Power Technologies solutions.Coordinate cross-functionally with internal departments (Marketing, Operations, Customer Service, Finance) to ensure seamless execution of sales initiatives and customer satisfaction.Participate in building and reinforcing company culture consistent with company purpose and values.Hold self and others accountable to conduct business in a manner compliant with Power Technologies’ policies and procedures and internal controls applicable to their role.Other duties as assigned.
CANDIDATE PROFILE:
The successful candidate will bring energy, initiative, and a collaborative mindset to the role. We are looking for a confident, competitive, and goal-oriented professional with a track record of building strong partnerships, managing remote teams, and delivering measurable results. This role requires a proactive approach to business development, with a focus on expanding global channel relationships and supporting the growth of the company’s product lines in international markets.
EXPERIENCE AND REQUIREMENTS
BA, BS degree is required.5+ years related sales or experience leading multi-person, multi-region international sales teams with demonstrated ability to navigate complex reseller and distributor organizations, build distribution through Warehouse Stocking Distributors and Resellers specifically within EdTech market is required.Excellent sales skills and sales leadership capabilities; exceptionally strong negotiation and consultation skillsAbility to deliver results against sales targets, with a proven record.Proven ability to engage in middle, senior, and C-level management structures.An articulate and effective communicator with demonstrated negotiation skills across multiple services and functions.Experienced in functioning effectively in an international environment.Ability to respond and work well under pressure and change.Proactive, highly organized, and detail-oriented with the ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time effectively.Demonstrated ability to prioritize effectively, supporting multiple channel partners.Excellent presentation skillsStrong computer skills – specifically Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.CRM experience required; NetSuite experience is a bonus.Proficient in English and German, multilingual a plusAbility to travel up to 60% internationally.

description.text:
ABOUT BEDROCKBedrock is a media-tech venture, formed as a JV between M6 and RTL Group (part of Bertelsmann). The company is the trusted strategic streaming partner of leading entertainment companies in Europe, operating their full streaming services and delivering state-of-the-art experience to their audiences.With 15+ years of streaming expertise and 450 skilled professionals in 10 countries, Bedrock has become the premier strategic streaming platform in Europe.At Bedrock, we love challenges, whether they're related to features, scaling, performance or peak traffic. We believe that learning new tricks is a journey and sharing them with peers is definitely part of the fun.

Bedrock is looking for a Product Manager with a strong background in Product Management (3+ years) to join our team and contribute to the product strategy, roadmap, and implementation of our platform's advertising monetization capabilities.
You'll be instrumental in the design and delivery of solutions that enable broadcasters and media companies to optimize their advertising revenue and enhance the user ad experience.
This is an exciting opportunity for someone who thrives on turning complex problems into impactful solutions, and who is curious about the Advertising ecosystem (display, video, audio, programmatic, etc.).While prior experience in advertising tech (Ad Servers, SSPs, DSPs…) is a plus what matters is your solid experience in Product Management and your interest in the Ads domain.
MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES
This role offers significant learning opportunities as you help define flexible, scalable solutions supporting diverse ad formats and targeting strategies. You'll operate within a dynamic and evolving ecosystem, ensuring our platform effectively integrates with key third-party advertising systems and addresses our clients' specific business challenges, ultimately reinforcing their trust in our solutions.
As a Product Manager, you will :
Drive Product Strategy: Contribute to the development of our Ads monetization roadmap and help align it with business goals and client needs to maximize advertising revenue.
Build impactful Ad Products: Support the product discovery process and feature delivery within the advertising domain. Contribute to the design and delivery of flexible, configurable tools that allow clients to effectively manage their ad inventories, formats, and targeting strategies.
Assist with Ad Ecosystem & Integration Strategy: Participate in defining and streamlining the platform's integration strategy with Ad Servers, programmatic platforms (SSPs, DSPs), and other ad technologies used by our clients. Help ensure robust connectivity and leverage ecosystem capabilities.
Represent Client & User Needs -Advertising-: Contribute to translating broadcasters' ad monetization strategies into scalable and reliable product features. Help promote solutions that balance platform consistency with necessary customization and configurability. Ensure a high-quality, non-intrusive user ad experience.
Leverage data : Work closely with Data Science/BI teams to define advertising KPIs, analyze platform and client data (e.g., fill rates, click-through rates, RPMs) to derive actionable insights. Participate in defining, prioritizing, and analyzing experiments (A/B tests) to validate hypotheses and optimize ad performance.
Collaborate across teams  Partner with Engineering, UX/UI, Data, Architecture, and Go-To-Market to ensure smooth execution from discovery to deployment. 


WHAT WE’ RE LOOKING FOR
3+ years of experience as a Product Manager, ideally in a B2B SaaS/PaaS environmentStrong ownership mindset, capable of managing products from idea to launch and beyond
Curiosity about Ads monetization models and advertising technology — experience in the field is a plus, but not a must
Analytical skills and a data-informed approach to decision-making
Ability to communicate clearly and collaborate with both technical and non-technical teamsand to influence cross-functional teams and build consensus
A proactive, structured, and adaptable working style
Excellent communication and presentation skills : Ability to clearly articulate complex concepts, strategies, and trade-offs to diverse audiences, including executives, technical teams, and clients. 

Beyond technical skills, we are looking for talents with:
Excellent team player who fosters collaborationAbility to adapt to changing environments and challengesStrong focus on client satisfaction and delivering high-quality serviceInnovative mindset with a passion for continuous improvementFluent in English
LIFE AT BEDROCKYou'll join an enthusiastic, friendly and close-knit team in a fast-growing tech company with more than 10 years' experience and a strong network of media shareholders.Work flexibility and brand-new office spaces with a great location.A top-notch tech expertise : documentation, support, R&D, management seniority…Work Evolutions & opportunities within the company, as well as training.Strong human connections knowledge sharing: Last Friday Talks, Demos, Meet-Ups, HR Roadshows

description.text:
Our client is a global leader in surgical innovation, focused on advancing technologies that improve outcomes for both patients and providers. They are seeking a Senior Regional Marketing Manager to drive downstream marketing strategy and execution across the region.
In this role, you will be responsible for developing marketing strategies, leading product launches, supporting field execution, and ensuring the commercial success of a highly technical product portfolio.
The position requires a balance of strategic thinking, hands-on execution, and cross-functional collaboration with sales, product management, and clinical teams.

Key responsibilities Develop and implement comprehensive downstream marketing strategies and tactics aligned to business objectives and commercial targets, based on market research and competitor analysisLead regional product launches in close collaboration with upstream product management, driving launch strategies, generating marketing materials, and executing commercialization programs including sales readiness trainingPartner with Marketing Communications to manage and enhance brand presence through marketing campaigns, convention strategy, and tailored collateral with clear product positioning and messagingProvide strategic and prioritized direction to the sales organization through marketing plans, training presentations, and ongoing communicationStay connected to customer needs and market trends by building relationships with KOLs, customers, and industry stakeholders to inform product launch plans and regional strategiesDevelop and deploy customer engagement programs, including advocacy initiatives, congress activities, and experience eventsCollaborate with cross-functional teams including sales, professional affairs, market development, and regulatory affairs to drive market expansion strategiesAct as a subject matter expert on the product portfolio, championing and communicating the value proposition internally and externallyEnsure marketing activities comply with industry regulations and company standardsTravel to customer sites to support clinical cases, training programs, and key industry eventsManage the departmental budget, ensuring efficient resource allocation
Key Requirements Minimum of five years of product marketing, clinical or marketing, or field sales experience within medical devices or capital equipment with highly technical productsProven experience in downstream marketing including scaled product launchesStrong ability to analyze market and financial data and translate insights into actionable strategyAbility to establish credibility quickly with customers, KOLs, and internal stakeholdersExcellent communication, presentation, and influencing skillsCustomer-focused mindset with a strong drive for resultsTrack record of working effectively in cross-functional and multidisciplinary teamsTravel across Europe ~20%
What Our Client OffersA mission-driven culture with a clear focus on improving surgical outcomesCollaborative colleagues who value teamwork and integrityThe chance to work on breakthrough technologies that directly impact patients’ livesOpportunities to develop your strengths, follow your passion, and advance your careerA flexible, engaging work environmentA competitive benefits package
If you’re interested in learning more please apply below!

description.text:
Title: French Speaking Product Marketing Manager – Digital Solutions Europe

Location: Remote within EU

Department: Marketing

Reports To: Product Marketing Director (based in Europe)

Functional Group: Digital Solutions

About FoodChain ID

FoodChain ID (www.foodchainid.com) is a global leader in food safety, quality, and sustainability solutions. Our Digital Solutions division helps agribusinesses, manufacturers, and retailers navigate regulatory complexity and unlock value through trusted, data-driven insights.

About The Role

We’re looking for a strategic and execution-focused Product Marketing Manager to support our Digital Solutions (Agricultural Solutions, Supplements, Packaging) portfolio across Europe, with a particular focus on French-speaking markets. You will drive product positioning, go-to-market strategies, and campaign execution for digital solutions focused on agricultural solutions, packaging and supplements.

This is a remote role within the EU and requires full professional fluency in French.

Key Responsibilities

Market Strategy & PositioningDefine the product positioning and messaging for digital solutions across European markets, with specific focus on French-speaking regionsIdentify local regulatory drivers and competitive dynamics to inform go-to-market approachesGo-to-Market ExecutionPlan and execute launches for new solutions in collaboration with commercial teamLocalize and adapt global messaging to resonate with regional and market-specific needsSales EnablementCreate localized sales tools: pitch decks, one-pagers, value propositions, objection-handling guidesDeliver training and support to regional sales and customer-facing teamsCampaign Support & Demand GenerationSupport campaign execution targeting ag input suppliers, distributors, and cooperatives across EuropeTrack campaign performance and support optimization based on engagement dataVoice of CustomerLead customer interviews and gather market insights to refine personas, positioning, and product roadmap inputsCross-functional CollaborationWork closely with Product, Sales, Regulatory, and the broader Marketing team to align priorities and initiatives
Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in marketing, or a related field (Master’s a plus)5+ years’ experience in B2B product marketing, preferably in agricultural solutions, packaging or supplementsNative or fluent French speaker; professional English requiredProven success in launching products and creating regional market demandExcellent communication skills and project management abilitiesExperience working in a matrixed, global environment

Nice to have

Experience with the following tools: SalesForce, PowerBI, Wordpress, ChatGPT

Performance Indicators

Pipeline generation across European marketsMarketing-sourced lead generation and conversionCampaign ROI and pipeline contributionMQL to Pipeline conversionEffectiveness of localized positioning and messaging

Note: This is a remote role with a preference for candidates based in France or neighboring EU countries. The ability to travel occasionally for team meetings or customer engagements is expected.

description.text:
Dans le cadre de l'obligation prochaine de réception et d’émission sous format électronique des factures de transactions entre assujettis à la TVA en France et la transmission des données y figurant à l'administration, l’AIFE met en œuvre le portail public de facturation (PPF), en collaboration étroite avec la direction générale desfinances publiques (DGFiP).
Ce portail met en œuvre de nouvelles briques applicatives :
• une brique « Facturation » (e-invoicing) : dépôt des données de factures entreassujettis à la TVA en France et les statuts obligatoires de ces factures,• une brique « Annuaire » : modalités d’adressage et de routage des facturesdématérialisées à destination des assujettis et des entités publiques,• une brique « Déclaration » (e-reporting) : déclaration des transactions impliquantun assujetti à la TVA (hors e-invoicing),• un « Concentrateur » qui a vocation à centraliser l’ensemble des informations et lestransmettre au système d’information de la DGFiP,• un Système d’Echange (SE) pour véhiculer et transmettre les différents flux. Le PPF s'inscrit dans l'environnement applicatif de l'AIFE et s’articule notammentétroitement avec les fonctionnalités du portail « Chorus Pro ».Dans ce cadre, placée sous l'autorité du responsable de la maîtrise d'ouvrage du PPF, vous participerez aux travaux de l'équipe MOA en étroite collaboration avec les bureaux métiers concernés. Vos principales missions :• rédaction des spécifications détaillées ;• appui à la réalisation des phases de tests ;• appui à la conduite du changement ;• maintien de la documentation projet.
Afin de vous accompagner dans votre prise de fonction, vous intégrerez une équipe composée de collègues expérimentés et disposerez d’une documentation sur le projet. Comme tout collaborateur de l'AIFE, vous aurez la la possibilité de suivre des formations adaptées à votre poste.

description.text:
Editage, the flagship brand of CACTUS, provides translation services to help ESL (English-as-a-second-language) researchers communicate their science to the global scientific community. We are currently looking for skilled translators to work with us on a freelance basis.

Job description

We are looking for translators to work on non-academic content written in various languages. To qualify, you must have subject expertise in the required field. Experience working in a foreign-language setting will be preferred. Essentially, your work will involve translating content from the original language to native English or vice versa.

Requirements

Applicants must meet any one of the following criteria:

A degree in Translation or an equivalent degree that includes significant translation training, from a recognized institutionA graduate (or higher) degree in any other field from a recognized institution of higher education plus two years of comprehensive professional experience in translationFive years of comprehensive professional experience in translation


Note: If you were associated with us in a similar role in the past, please contact us at freelancetranslator@cactusglobal.com before you apply/register.

description.text:
Vestiaire Collective is the leading global online marketplace for desirable pre-loved fashion. Our mission is to transform the fashion industry for a more sustainable future by empowering our community to promote the circular fashion movement. Vestiaire was founded in 2009 and is headquartered in Paris with offices in London, Berlin, New York, Singapore, Ho Chi Minh and Hong Kong and warehouses in Tourcoing (France), Crawley (UK), Hong Kong and New York.

We currently have a diverse global team of 700 employees representing more than 50 nationalities. Our values are Activism, Transparency, Dedication and Greatness and Collective. We are proud to be a BCorp.

About The Role 🖥️
Based in our Parisian office and reporting to the Director of HRBP Manager, you will join a team of five HR Business Partners, all fully dedicated to developing Vestiaire Collective on a global scale.

As an HRBP, your role will be to:

Collaborate with managers and department heads to align HR initiatives with business objectives

Support managers in managing complex employee relations and resolving conflicts

Develop and implement initiatives aimed at improving employee engagement and talent retention

What You Will Do 👜

Organizational Development Oversee the organizational development of Marketing and Commercial teams Ensure the application of our global HR strategy and policies, while respecting operational requirements Collaborate with other People Partners (Learning & Development, Legal, Talent) to build, continuously improve, and deploy processes related to the employee experience



Be a true partner to your teams

 Drive change management to support employees and managers in implementing new initiatives Support team performance and achievement of objectives by providing HR expertise and ensuring compliance with legal and contractual rules Monitor workplace climate, actively identify early warning signs, and maintain a regular on-site presence Maintain contact and collaborate with occupational health services to ensure individual employee follow-up



Team Development

 Support managers during performance reviews or sensitive situations Help leaders develop and strengthen their skills Conduct annual salary and compensation reviews, ensuring equality and equity Contribute to the annual performance review process, ensuring it remains dynamic and adapted to the company’s evolution



Who You Are ⭐

description.text:
RemotePermanent or Full-time ContractorCompetitive package

About Us

ClickOut Media is not just a company - it's a thriving ecosystem of diverse talent from around the globe. As a proudly remote-first organisation, we've cultivated an environment where creativity flourishes, collaboration is core, and innovation knows no bounds. With over +850 team members and more than 200 assets, our startup culture fuels our growth, making us a leading force in multi-channel marketing. We specialise in delivering best-in-class SEO & Content solutions to esteemed clients worldwide.

What Makes Us Different

At ClickOut Media, we thrive in the most competitive search verticals, operate across every major language, and conquer platforms you've probably never even heard of. Our dynamic approach, combined with our fast-paced environment, sets us apart in the industry. We're not just here to meet expectations; we're here to exceed them, every single time. Our relentless pursuit of excellence has been the cornerstone of our continuous success.

Job Description

We're looking for a talented and detail-oriented SEO Content Editor to join our growing team of gambling content specialists. You'll play a key role in shaping and optimising content across English-language gambling projects, including but not limited to those covering casinos, sports betting, esports, and crypto betting.

Responsibilities

Collaborate with freelancers and internal teams (including Editors, SEO, Design, Product, and Affiliation) to publish high-quality, SEO-optimized, and user-focused content that aligns with brand and business goals.Edit and optimize content for search intent, readability, and SEO best practices - including title tags, internal linking, metadata, alt text, and imagery.Audit existing content to identify outdated articles, content gaps, and new opportunities to improve authority and rankings.Regularly update and enhance existing articles to maintain accuracy, freshness, and SEO performance.Commission, brief, and manage content creation from both staff and freelance writers using keyword research, search trends, and competitor analysis.Contribute to ongoing content strategy by identifying trending topics and new keyword opportunities to grow organic traffic.Support the Head of Content with content planning, publishing workflows, and managing the editorial calendar to ensure timely delivery.Stay informed on the latest SEO developments, gambling industry news, and content best practices - using insights to enhance the quality and relevance of published content.Collaborate closely with the wider content and SEO team to maintain consistency, voice, and quality across all published material.

Qualifications

Fluent in the English language, with excellent grammar, spelling, and punctuation skills.Proven experience as an Editor, Content Manager, or similar role within the iGaming industry - ideally with exposure to esports, casinos, and affiliate content.Good to intermediate understanding of SEO, including keyword research, on-page optimization, and familiarity with tools like Ahrefs, Semrush, or similar.Comfortable using WordPress to upload, edit, and publish content.Solid understanding of online gambling terminology, products, player intent, and current industry trends.Strong attention to detail and a high standard for content accuracy, formatting, and SEO compliance.Excellent organizational and time management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.Effective communication and collaboration skills, working well across teams (e.g., writers, SEO, design, and product).A genuine interest in online gambling, esports, and betting — and a desire to stay informed on market developments.Self-motivated and proactive, with the ability to contribute ideas and improve workflows and content strategy.Strong problem-solving skills in fast-paced and changing editorial environments.

Preferred Qualifications

Ability to QA and refine AI-generated content while ensuring compliance with quality and tone.Understanding of plagiarism and originality tools (e.g., Copyscape, Grammarly, Originality.ai).Familiarity with crypto betting, blockchain gambling platforms, or Web3 technologies.Working knowledge of Google Search Console, Google Analytics, or similar performance tracking tools.Familiarity with brief templates and systems to streamline and standardize large-scale content production.Understanding of odds formats, betting systems, and user personas within betting ecosystems.

Benefits & Rewards

A brilliant opportunity to grow your career & work with a fun, fast-paced & growing company, prepared to let you shineAn entrepreneurial environment where you learn more every day (we more than welcome and support people with their own projects)Build an organization that continues to diversify its portfolioPersonal responsibility with a ton of autonomy33 free paid daysMarket-leading remunerationAn international team with over 35 nationalitiesFully Remote working (work fully remotely and option for weekly coworker space)Additional benefits for permanent employees are available depending on the location

What do we mean by "Fully Remote"

Clickout Media offers you an unparalleled working experience. We are registered in Malta, but you don't have to be. Wherever you are based, and whether you are employed, operate B2B, or are a career freelancer, we will always find a way to work with great people.

Engaging with a worldwide workforce, ClickOut Media brings together world-leading experts in the fields of Tech, SEO, Content, and Product. Our remote approach gives absolute flexibility to our people and exemplifies our philosophy of autonomy and trust.

Diversity is a given to us, and this unique approach allows us to deliver and have respect for the wide variety of people, experiences, and cultures we bring together.

Our Recruitment Process Is As Follows

ApplyHave an introduction call with our recruitment teamDo a testHave a technical interview

Equal Opportunities

ClickOut Media is an equal-opportunity employer welcoming applicants from all backgrounds.

description.text:
Chez Teliosa, notre mission est de rendre la thérapie plus accessiblePourquoi la thérapie ?615 millions de personnes souffrent de grave problème de santé mentaleLe covid a empiré les chosesDes personnes en grande souffrance n’arrivent pas à trouver la bonne personne pour les aider.
Qu’est-ce qu’ont fait ?On aide les thérapeutes à aider plus de monde
Comment on le fait?On a créé un programme qui donne aux thérapeutes les outils, les connaissances et l’accompagnement nécessaire pour réussir
En 3 ans, on est passés de 0 à2000 thérapeutes accompagnés5 millions € de CA/an - 70 % de net profitUne équipe de 15 personnes
En 2025, on veut :Grossir à 10 million € de revenuAider 1000 thérapeutes
Vous postulez pour la partie francaise : https://teliosa.com/
Nous sommes à la recherche d'un(e) Customer Success Manager (CSM) pour notre formation.
Ta mission sera :Animer des sessions live sur Zoom pour aider nos élèves thérapeutes à développer leur activité (business et marketing)Répondre aux questions de nos élèves sur le groupe Facebook privéFavoriser une énergie positive dans les échanges pour générer un maximum d'avis et témoignages positifsCollecter les retours sur notre programme pour l'améliorer en continu
Les choses sur lesquelles tu travailleras :Stratégie marketing pour thérapeutesDéveloppement du mindset entrepreneurialCréation et customisation de sites internet avec LeadpagesUtilisation stratégique des réseaux sociaux pour développer son activité gratuitementOptimisation SEOConfiguration et amélioration des fiches Google My BusinessMise en place de campagnes Google Ads et Facebook Ads
Ce job est fait pour toi si :Tu as une expérience dans la relation client, l'accompagnement d'entrepreneurs ou de thérapeutesTu t’intéresses au marketing digitalesTu aimes partager ton savoir et voir les autres réussir grâce à tes conseilsTu es à l'aise avec les outils digitals et les réseaxu sociauxTu as des bases en Google Ads et Facebook AdsTu es dynamique, positif(ve) et sais créer une ambiance motivanteTu es bienveillant(e) et coachable
Ce n'est pas fait pour toi si :Tu n'aimes pas le contact humain et l'animation de groupeTu préfères travailler sur des projets ponctuels sans suiviTu n'es pas à l'aise avec les outils digitauxTu n'as pas d'intérêt pour le secteur du bien-être et de la thérapie
Les choses cools que tu auras :L'opportunité d'aider des thérapeutes à développer leur activité et avoir un impact positifL'opportunité de progresser et de te perfectionner dans de multiples domaines complémentaires (marketing digital, techniques de vente, gestion de la relation client)Beaucoup d'autonomie dans ton travailRejoindre une équipe dynamique et passionnéeLa possibilité de travailler à distance (100% télétravail)Un environnement de travail stimulant et en constante évolutionL'accès à une communauté engagée de professionnels du bien-être
Chez nous, pas de CV ni de lettre de motivation, seules les skills comptent !
Il suffit de remplir ce questionnaire et nous vous recontacterons :https://3pvzkf2zd8p.typeform.com/to/l0YduVsJ

description.text:
Join Our Team as a UX/UI Designer in the thriving iGaming Industry! 🚀
🧩Who we are? Ludicrum is redefining iGaming, blending creativity with technology to deliver world-class gaming experiences. From marketing and product development to customer support and financial reporting, our teams are changing the game. Our vision is to create ultra-intuitive and engaging platforms to fuel growth through strategic partnerships and market expansion.Our success is driven by core values deeply embedded in our culture. We believe in transparency, always being clear, open, and honest. We are goal-focused, relentlessly pursuing our targets. Adaptability is key—we embrace change and use it to excel. Kaizen guides us, as we continuously improve, test, and refine.With a dynamic and collaborative culture and fast career growth, our 250+ global team thrives!
🥜 In a nutshellWe are seeking a talented UX/UI Designer to join our growing design team. Reporting to the UX/UI Team Lead, you’ll play a key role in crafting intuitive, inclusive, and visually compelling user experiences for our platforms. You’ll collaborate closely with developers and stakeholders across the business to bring ideas to life that truly serve our users.
🎯 The responsibilities & the impact YOU will have:Conduct user research to understand needs, preferences, and behaviorsPerform usability testing and gather feedback for continuous improvementCreate and maintain site maps, user flows, wireframes, and prototypesStructure and organize content to enhance navigation and experienceDesign responsive, visually appealing, and user-friendly interfacesEnsure all designs meet accessibility standards and perform audits as neededCollaborate with developers to ensure seamless implementation of designsStay ahead of industry trends and contribute to evolving design systems
⚡ All you need is…2+ years of experience as a UX/UI Designer in the iGaming industry, with a portfolio showcasing user research and impactful design solutions.Proficiency in Figma, with the ability to structure content and design intuitive navigation and user flows.Strong visual and interaction design skills, creating elegant, user-friendly, and effective interfaces.Solid knowledge of accessibility standards, ensuring inclusive and compliant design for all users.Proven collaboration with developers and stakeholders, delivering designs in agile, cross-functional teams Nice to haveUnderstanding of HCI principles, applying research-driven methods to guide interface and interaction design.Insight into user psychology, enabling the creation of more intuitive, user-centered experiences.Background in graphic design, adding visual clarity and storytelling to your work.Experience with usability testing, including A/B testing, user journeys, and time-on-task analysis.
🌟 Why You’ll love working here:Flexible and Remote Working: Work from anywhere, supporting your work-life balance.Career Growth: We’re committed to your development, offering training and advancement opportunities.Health and Fitness Benefits: Receive fitness reimbursements from day one, and after one year of employment, gain access to a health budget to support your well-being.Extra Paid Annual Leave: Enjoy 22 days of vacation, with an additional day added for each year of employment, up to a maximum of 26 days.Special Birthday Perk: Take your birthday off after a year of employment to celebrate!
We are not just offering a job; we offer the chance to be part of something bigger. Apply today! Submit your resume in English and join us in creating unforgettable experiences. We can’t wait to hear from you!

description.text:
"Fnac Darty, un leader européen de la distribution omnicanal. Acteur omnicanal et européen, spécialisé dans la distribution de produits techniques et d'électroménager, de biens culturels et de loisirs, et leader du service après-vente présent dans 13 pays, avec 1005 magasins dans le monde, 11 millions d'abonnés/adhérents et 29 millions de visiteurs uniques cumulés par mois sur nos sites marchands. Nos 25 000 collaborateurs sont notre meilleur atout. Ils font vivre la raison d'être du Groupe au quotidien, qui consiste à « s'engager pour un choix éclairé et une consommation durable », auprès de nos clients. Fnac Darty recrute partout en France des talents aux profils, formations et expériences très diverses, que ce soit pour ses magasins, mais aussi dans les domaines de la logistique, de la réparation et service après-vente, de la livraison, de la relation client ou encore pour ses fonctions support. Chez Fnac Darty, nous recrutons sur les compétences, en accordant de l'attention à toutes les candidatures. Nous nous engageons à promouvoir la diversité, sans distinction d'origine, d'âge, de handicap, de genre ou d'orientation sexuelle, … dans un environnement respectueux de chaque personne. Votre prochain emploi vous attend chez Fnac Darty !",

Au sein de la Direction Marketing, le/la Chef(fe) de projet Marketing Généraliste joue un rôle clé dans la coordination, la priorisation et la mise en œuvre des actions marketing en lien avec la Marketing Factory (équipes Print & Webdesign). Il/elle agit comme un point de contact central entre les équipes métiers, les partenaires internes et externes, et les équipes de production.

Missions Principales

 Arbitrage et priorisation des demandes Collaborer avec l’Animco et les équipes concernées pour arbitrer et prioriser les demandes adressées à la Marketing Factory. Évaluer la pertinence, l’impact et la faisabilité des demandes en fonction des ressources disponibles et des objectifs commerciaux. Cadrage des besoins Cadrer et challenger les besoins exprimés par les équipes émettrices (investissements, volume de supports, délais). Instruire les demandes internes afin d’évaluer leur niveau de priorité et les ressources nécessaires à leur réalisation. Coordination avec la Marketing Factory (Publicis) Briefer le Lead Marketing Factory sur les besoins identifiés afin de projeter le bon niveau de ressources Assurer le suivi du budget avec le Lead Marketing Factory Participation aux instances de pilotage Participer activement aux réunions hebdomadaires d’animation commerciale et aux points mensuels avec la Direction Commerciale. Gestion de la relation avec les partenaires externes Cadrer la relation commerciale avec les prestataires externes en lien avec les métiers Print & Webdesign. Garantir la qualité et la ponctualité des livrables produits par la Marketing Factory.

Profil Recherché

 Excellentes capacités de coordination, d’analyse et de priorisation. Aisance relationnelle et sens du travail en équipe. Connaissance des environnements Print & Webdesign appréciée. Capacité à évoluer dans un environnement dynamique et multi-interlocuteurs.

Et une expérience sur un même type de poste et environnement de 7 à 10 ans.

detailed_info.title: Chef de projet Marketing Généraliste F/H

jobs_analyzed.description:
"Fnac Darty, un leader européen de la distribution omnicanal. Acteur omnicanal et européen, spécialisé dans la distribution de produits techniques et d'électroménager, de biens culturels et de loisirs, et leader du service après-vente présent dans 13 pays, avec 1005 magasins dans le monde, 11 millions d'abonnés/adhérents et 29 millions de visiteurs uniques cumulés par mois sur nos sites marchands. Nos 25 000 collaborateurs sont notre meilleur atout. Ils font vivre la raison d'être du Groupe au quotidien, qui consiste à « s'engager pour un choix éclairé et une consommation durable », auprès de nos clients. Fnac Darty recrute partout en France des talents aux profils, formations et expériences très diverses, que ce soit pour ses magasins, mais aussi dans les domaines de la logistique, de la réparation et service après-vente, de la livraison, de la relation client ou encore pour ses fonctions support. Chez Fnac Darty, nous recrutons sur les compétences, en accordant de l'attention à toutes les candidatures. Nous nous engageons à promouvoir la diversité, sans distinction d'origine, d'âge, de handicap, de genre ou d'orientation sexuelle, … dans un environnement respectueux de chaque personne. Votre prochain emploi vous attend chez Fnac Darty !",

Au sein de la Direction Marketing, le/la Chef(fe) de projet Marketing Généraliste joue un rôle clé dans la coordination, la priorisation et la mise en œuvre des actions marketing en lien avec la Marketing Factory (équipes Print & Webdesign). Il/elle agit comme un point de contact central entre les équipes métiers, les partenaires internes et externes, et les équipes de production.

Missions Principales

 Arbitrage et priorisation des demandes Collaborer avec l’Animco et les équipes concernées pour arbitrer et prioriser les demandes adressées à la Marketing Factory. Évaluer la pertinence, l’impact et la faisabilité des demandes en fonction des ressources disponibles et des objectifs commerciaux. Cadrage des besoins Cadrer et challenger les besoins exprimés par les équipes émettrices (investissements, volume de supports, délais). Instruire les demandes internes afin d’évaluer leur niveau de priorité et les ressources nécessaires à leur réalisation. Coordination avec la Marketing Factory (Publicis) Briefer le Lead Marketing Factory sur les besoins identifiés afin de projeter le bon niveau de ressources Assurer le suivi du budget avec le Lead Marketing Factory Participation aux instances de pilotage Participer activement aux réunions hebdomadaires d’animation commerciale et aux points mensuels avec la Direction Commerciale. Gestion de la relation avec les partenaires externes Cadrer la relation commerciale avec les prestataires externes en lien avec les métiers Print & Webdesign. Garantir la qualité et la ponctualité des livrables produits par la Marketing Factory.

Profil Recherché

 Excellentes capacités de coordination, d’analyse et de priorisation. Aisance relationnelle et sens du travail en équipe. Connaissance des environnements Print & Webdesign appréciée. Capacité à évoluer dans un environnement dynamique et multi-interlocuteurs.

Et une expérience sur un même type de poste et environnement de 7 à 10 ans.

description.text:
Job Highlights:Contract: Independent ContractorSchedule: Between 9:00 am to 4:00 pm, Ambler, PA, USA, Eastern Time
Job Overview:We are looking for a part-time virtual assistant to help modernize and maintain our existing website. This role will initially require monthly updates to keep our site fresh, functional, and aligned with industry trends. After an initial period, the update frequency will shift to a quarterly schedule while still ensuring our website remains visually appealing and optimized for performance.
Responsibilities:Website Modernization: Implement updates to enhance the look, feel, and user experience of our site, including layout improvements, updated visuals, and mobile responsiveness.Content Updates: Modify website content as needed to reflect the latest company offerings, partnerships, and industry trends.SEO Optimization: Perform quarterly SEO audits and updates to improve search rankings and ensure our website remains competitive in organic search results.Performance Monitoring: Identify and resolve technical issues affecting site speed, navigation, and overall functionality.Collaboration: Work closely with our team to ensure updates align with our branding and business objectives.
RequirementsThis is a part-time, remote position, with working hoursProficiency in website design and maintenance (WordPress, HTML, CSS, or relevant CMS platforms).Strong understanding of SEO best practices and tools like Google Analytics, SEMrush, or Yoast.Experience in UX/UI enhancements to improve visitor engagement.Detail-oriented with the ability to work independently and meet deadlines.Prior experience in the parking technology or related industries is a plus but not required.
BenefitsIndependent Contractor Perks:Permanent work from homeImmediate hiringSteady freelance job
Please note that since this is a permanent work-from-home position and an “Independent Contractor” arrangement, the candidates must have their own computer and internet connection. They will handle their own benefits and taxes. The professional fees are on hourly rates and the rate depends on your performance in the application process.

basic_info.title: Director of Marketing Intelligence & Research Integrity

description.text:
Location: Remote AnywhereReports to: Executive Director/CCODepartment: Executive Leadership – Research & Intelligence
Collectivus Holdings oversees the most prestigious brands in the Collecting, Trading Card Game, and Hobby industries. With a century of combined expertise in pioneering products, delivering exceptional quality, and enhancing customer experiences, Collectivus is synonymous with excellence. Our portfolio includes Beckett, Dragon Shield, Southern Hobby, and Merchant Guild— four brands with decades of expertise and dedication to elevating the collecting experience for enthusiasts and businesses alike.
About Us:Welcome to Merchant Guild, where passion meets purpose!We are a consulting and support agency dedicated to empowering the trading card game (TCG) and tabletop gaming industry.Our mission is not just to grow sales but to ignite the spirit of adventure within the hobby ecosystem, helping local game stores thrive.Through tailored strategies, market insights, and hands-on support, we equip retailers, distributors, and publishers to embrace the exciting future of gaming.Join us in shaping an industry where collaboration, creativity, and opportunity drive lasting success.
Role OverviewThe Director of Market Intelligence & Research Integrity is a senior executive responsible for setting the vision, strategy, and execution of Merchant Guild’s global research, analytics, data quality, and service pricing structure. This role merges the strategic foresight of market insight collected through the Retail Consultant network with the rigorous oversight of research integrity, while also driving the pricing strategy for Merchant Guild packages and pricing its services for maximum industry impact based on a strong insight into the global competitive landscape.
As the Guild’s top authority in market intelligence, this leader ensures that every data-driven product — from market reports to custom research engagements — delivers high-value insights built on uncompromising accuracy. At the same time, they develop and manage a pricing framework that aligns Merchant Guild’s offerings with industry demand, competitive positioning, and revenue objectives.
Key Responsibilities
Strategic LeadershipDefine and execute Merchant Guild’s research, analytics, and pricing strategy, ensuring alignment with long-term organizational goals.Collect information from the Retail Consultant to identify market trends, industry shifts, and competitive landscapes.Lead the production of flagship reports, market forecasts, and member intelligence briefings.
Market Insights & AnalyticsDirect the design of market research projects, including quantitative, qualitative, and hybrid methodologies.Oversee predictive analytics, scenario modelling, and competitive benchmarking.Ensure insights are effectively visualized, communicated, and actionable for varied audiences.
Research Quality & IntegrityEstablish and maintain rigorous quality assurance standards for all research outputs.Audit methodologies, validate data sources, and oversee peer review processes.Ensure compliance with ethical research practices and relevant data privacy laws (GDPR, CCPA).
Pricing Strategy & Commercial OversightDevelop and maintain a dynamic pricing framework for Merchant Guild’s research products, memberships, and consulting services.Conduct market-based pricing analysis to ensure competitive positioning while maximizing value and revenue.Collaborate with partnership managers to tailor pricing for custom projects, partnerships, and tiered service offerings.Monitor pricing performance and adjust strategies based on market feedback, demand trends, and profitability targets.
Qualifications8+ years in research operations, data governance, or analytics quality assurance.Strong track record in methodological design, data validation, and compliance.Strong understanding of pricing models, elasticity analysis, and value-based pricing approaches.Expertise in statistical techniques, sampling, and error mitigation.Familiarity with international data privacy laws (GDPR, CCPA) and ethical research practices.Exceptional attention to detail and commitment to accuracy.Proficiency with analytics tools and quality-checking processes.
Performance Metrics & Success Indicators
Research & Insights Delivery98%+ on-time delivery rate for research projects and reports.Zero critical accuracy errors in published research outputs.Stakeholder satisfaction scores of 8/10+ for relevance, clarity, and actionability of insights.
Data Quality & IntegrityAnnual methodology audit pass rate of 100% with no compliance breaches.Reduction in data discrepancies and errors year-over-year.Full compliance with GDPR, CCPA, and internal ethics standards.
Pricing & Revenue ImpactRevenue growth from research services of X% YoY (target set annually).Pricing model adoption rate across at least 90% of product/service lines.

#LI-Remote

description.text:
The Company
TaskHuman is organizing the world’s human expertise, making coaching in 1000+ skills instantly accessible to you in a multitude of forms. Whether you connect live with a specialist on a 1:1 video call, message directly in-app, join a group session, or learn via coach-generated content, our value of human connection is the foundation of every interaction at TaskHuman.
The Opportunity
We’re looking for a hands-on, technically fluent Growth Marketer to drive rapid experimentation and growth loop execution to scale our acquisition and engagement programs. You will be instrumental in executing our growth strategy launching high-impact growth initiatives with speed and autonomy.This is a role for someone who loves to ship, test, and refine. In our B2B2C environment, your user activation and engagement work directly drives client success, making every conversion and retention win doubly important.
Responsibilities:
Design, implement, and optimize lifecycle-based growth programs across user onboarding, activation, re-engagement, and retention.Launch and scale growth loops and automated campaigns, using event-based triggers and conditional logic.Own the execution and iteration of experiment-driven campaigns, partnering with Product, Analytics and Data Science to rapidly test hypotheses and analyze funnel performance.Partner closely with BI/Analytics team to define success metrics, interpret campaign performance data, and translate insights into actionable optimizations for future campaigns.Operate and manage the marketing tech stack including Iterable, to support fast, self-serve execution across journeys and nudges.Collaborate with engineering and data teams to integrate rich custom event payloads into user workflows, enabling highly personalized, metadata-driven messaging experiences.Maintain execution velocity by owning backlog delivery of growth marketing experiments, ensuring rapid test cycles and continuous campaign optimization.Partner with internal teams including Product, Design, Customer Success, and Coaching Experiences to ensure aligned messaging, go-to-market enablement, and thematic consistency across touchpoints.Guide the structure and QA of AI-generated content for use in dynamic emails and in-product experiences.
Requirements:
3-6+ years experience in growth marketing, lifecycle marketing, or CRM/automation roles, preferably in a startup or fast-paced growth environment.Strong technical fluency with tools and systems like Iterable (or Braze), and event-driven trigger frameworks.Deep experience executing event-based lifecycle automations using custom user properties, branching logic, and dynamic content blocks.Familiarity with working inside JSON-based data structures for dynamic & personalized messaging.Track record of executing growth experiments and interpreting performance through funnel, cohort, and lifecycle metrics.Highly autonomous and self-directed, able to move quickly and make tradeoffs in ambiguous or fast-changing environments.Strong communicator and collaborator across technical and non-technical teams.Experience and appetite for working in a fast-paced technology and innovation environment are highly preferred.Genuine interest in the mission of TaskHuman and being a part of something bigger than any one person or business group.Experience operating in a B2C, B2B2C, or marketplace product environment
TaskHuman provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

basic_info.title: Senior Product Manager - Declarations & Financial Statements Group

description.text:
Are you looking to have an impact on the daily life of millions of entrepreneurs in France (and tomorrow in Europe)?

Are you looking for a work environment that values trust, proactivity, and autonomy?

Are our Product principles aligned with your vision?

Then Pennylane is the right place for you !

 Our vision 

We aim to become the most beloved financial Operating System of French SMEs and Accounting Firms (and soon, European ones).

We help entrepreneurs rid themselves of time-consuming tasks related to accounting and finance while providing them with access to key financial information to assist in making the best decisions for their business.

About Us

Pennylane is one of the fastest growing Fintechs in France (and soon to be in Europe!)

In 5 years of existence, we’ve managed to :

💻 Make ourselves known as a groundbreaking accounting and financial software for small businesses and their accountants

💰 Raise a total of €225 millions, including from Sequoia, the famous fund from the Silicon Valley who invested early in companies like Google, Facebook, Airbnb, Stripe, Paypal and much more...

👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 Grow from 7 cofounders to 650+ happy Pennylaners : we’re now recognized as one of the greatest places to work in France (and also remotely), with a 4.6/5 rating on Glassdoor .

🌍 Build an international environment with more than 25 nationalities, with a strong remote-friendly culture, where 30% of the employees are already working from all parts of Europe

🤝 Earn the trust of thousands of customers and accounting firms and obtain outstanding ratings

🚀 Already more than 400,000 small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) and over 4,500 accounting firms use Pennylane in France!

WHY this position is of utmost importance to reach our mission 

While some companies count on marketing and sales to gain market share, we are a product-led company and are investing primarily in our platform. You’ll join a team with a highly strategic role and a great opportunity to put your skills and ideas to a good use.

HOW you will contribute to the company as a PM 

As a Product Manager, you’ll be part of a 40+ people Product organisation, supported by an engineering team of more than 110 people.

 You’ll spend an extensive amount of time continuously discovering the users and their pain points. You will interview them, conduct user research and get your hands in our data platform to gather insights on what needs to be solved. With those insights and with the company’s objectives in mind, you’ll be empowered to define your OKRs and your roadmaps, to have the strongest possible impact on solving user problems and reaching the company's objectives. You’ll work hand in hand with a Product Designer dedicated to your squad, as well as a team of Product-centered engineers. You will start with small steps (we like the MVP approach!) and will follow-up on the implementation and future iterations. For us, achieving a common goal matter more than just building features.

Your squad :

As a Product Manager within our Declarations & Financial Statements group, you will help shape one of the most sensitive and strategic parts of the customer journey.

Our mission is to empower accounting firms to manage their clients seamlessly from A to Z, especially during critical moments when legal responsibilities are engaged and financial flows occur.

Your scope will cover the creation of an exhaustive, simple, and automated experience for all types of mandatory declarations, from pre-filling to submission, payment, client notification, and audit-readiness. You’ll also play a key role in delivering high-quality, customizable financial reports (the “plaquette”)—the accountant’s marketing document—ensuring they are both comprehensive and user-friendly.

This is a fast-evolving area with significant opportunities to innovate and build, as many features are still in their infancy.

You’ll be working on highly complex problems and shouldn’t be afraid to dive deep into the world of accounting. But technical and regulatory mastery is only part of the challenge: you’ll also need a sharp product mindset and a relentless focus on user experience.

Success in this role means not only researching and understanding key accounting rules and formulas, but also transforming this complexity into simple, intuitive, and robust solutions that delight our users. You’ll work closely with designers and engineers to create seamless, automated flows, making even the most intricate declarations accessible and efficient for our customers. If you thrive at the intersection of complexity, design, and impact, this is the perfect opportunity to make your mark.

WHAT You Can Expect From Your Life At Pennylane

Within one month

 You’ll learn everything about our company, our teams, and our vision during the first onboarding week You’ll familiarize yourself with the product and the accounting industry (You will have access to a lot of documentation and will assist to trainings organized by your peers) You’ll get a very deep knowledge of our Product organization, methods, and culture

Within 3 months

 You’ll have imagined and implemented your first solutions, hand-in-hand with Product Designers and Engineers You’ll have impacted positively at least one OKR You will have setup your continuous discovery routine and will be ready to build your roadmap

Within 6 months

 You’ll be autonomous at defining your OKRs and your roadmap You’ll keep having a strong impact via iterations on the solutions you've shipped You’ll share your learnings and best practices within the team

And beyond : The product team will double in size in two years.

Which means you’ll have :

 Multiple opportunities to recruit and mentor new PMs Increased responsibilities in project leadership Responsibilities to think of and implement new processes, tools and best practices to make sure that your team works even smoother

What do we do to make your work life easier

🏢 You'll be able to work remotely from anywhere in Europe, as long as your contract allows you to

📈 You'll get company shares to enjoy a piece of the success story you're building with us

🏡 You’ll have a budget to turn your home into a more comfortable workspace, as well as a monthly allowance to work from a coworking space whenever you feel like it

⛹️Through our partner Gymlib, you’ll have access to 8000 fitness spaces in Europe and more than 300 activities related to wellness

🇬🇧 You’ll have access to Busuu to perfect your english or your french

💻 You’ll get the latest Apple equipment

🎉 You’ll be part of a vibrant social community : we do lots of sports together (Foot, running, climbing...), we love to hang out and have a drink together (thursday afterwork drinks on our rooftop is a usual thing. Twice-a-year we do company seminars, last time we went on a trip to the French Alps and it was fabulous !)

And.. If you're based in France :

🏢 You’ll be able to work fully from your home or any co-working space in France, or from our wonderful office in the center of Paris

🏝You’ll get 10 additional days off (to the 25 standard ones) to rest and do what you love each year

🍜 You’ll have lunch credits (Swile card) to buy your favorite food every day

🏥 You’ll have a great healthcare cover (Alan Blue) to take care of yourself and your family

We're working on providing those last advantages to our people based outside of France as well, but it can be quite more complex depending on different countries. 

What does the recruitment process look like ? 

 You will first have a general chat with a Talent Acquisition Manager (30 min) You’ll then have a discussion with 1 member of our Product team to assess the fit and the Product culture (45 min) You’ll then pass a live case study with 2 PMs from our team (1h15) You'll have a final round with Tancrède (our CPO) and a Group PM or a Head of Product (60 mn)

We make sure we move fast ; you can expect the recruitment process with us to last between 15 and 25 days in total. 

Who are we looking for ?

 Strong user research skills and Product sense: ability to develop a strong conviction about user needs and problems based on user feedback (from all types of sources) Strong & structured communication skills to convince and get buy in on his/her vision, embark/drive the squad, build relationships with commercial teams, talk to users regularly.. Ability to navigate and simplify complex problems (understand, vulgarize, break problems into small pieces) Hands-on and not afraid to step out of the traditional product role to make the product succeed (working on Educational content, and enablement if needed..) Past experience in Product management at a scale up or large tech company is required (ideally a company with a strong product culture) Experience working with accounting is not required (generalist profile is ok) as long as they are curious about accounting and comfortable with complexity.

Your scope will cover the creation of an exhaustive, simple, and automated experience for all types of mandatory declarations, from pre-filling to submission, payment, client notification, and audit-readiness. You’ll also play a key role in delivering high-quality, customizable financial reports (the “plaquette”)—the accountant’s marketing document—ensuring they are both comprehensive and user-friendly.

This is a fast-evolving area with significant opportunities to innovate and build, as many features are still in their infancy.

You’ll be working on highly complex problems and shouldn’t be afraid to dive deep into the world of accounting. But technical and regulatory mastery is only part of the challenge: you’ll also need a sharp product mindset and a relentless focus on user experience.

Success in this role means not only researching and understanding key accounting rules and formulas, but also transforming this complexity into simple, intuitive, and robust solutions that delight our users. You’ll work closely with designers and engineers to create seamless, automated flows, making even the most intricate declarations accessible and efficient for our customers. If you thrive at the intersection of complexity, design, and impact, this is the perfect opportunity to make your mark.

WHAT You Can Expect From Your Life At Pennylane

Within one month

 You’ll learn everything about our company, our teams, and our vision during the first onboarding week You’ll familiarize yourself with the product and the accounting industry (You will have access to a lot of documentation and will assist to trainings organized by your peers) You’ll get a very deep knowledge of our Product organization, methods, and culture

Within 3 months

 You’ll have imagined and implemented your first solutions, hand-in-hand with Product Designers and Engineers You’ll have impacted positively at least one OKR You will have setup your continuous discovery routine and will be ready to build your roadmap

Within 6 months

 You’ll be autonomous at defining your OKRs and your roadmap You’ll keep having a strong impact via iterations on the solutions you've shipped You’ll share your learnings and best practices within the team

And beyond : The product team will double in size in two years.

Which means you’ll have :

 Multiple opportunities to recruit and mentor new PMs Increased responsibilities in project leadership Responsibilities to think of and implement new processes, tools and best practices to make sure that your team works even smoother

What do we do to make your work life easier

🏢 You'll be able to work remotely from anywhere in Europe, as long as your contract allows you to

📈 You'll get company shares to enjoy a piece of the success story you're building with us

🏡 You’ll have a budget to turn your home into a more comfortable workspace, as well as a monthly allowance to work from a coworking space whenever you feel like it

⛹️Through our partner Gymlib, you’ll have access to 8000 fitness spaces in Europe and more than 300 activities related to wellness

🇬🇧 You’ll have access to Busuu to perfect your english or your french

💻 You’ll get the latest Apple equipment

🎉 You’ll be part of a vibrant social community : we do lots of sports together (Foot, running, climbing...), we love to hang out and have a drink together (thursday afterwork drinks on our rooftop is a usual thing. Twice-a-year we do company seminars, last time we went on a trip to the French Alps and it was fabulous !)

And.. If you're based in France :

🏢 You’ll be able to work fully from your home or any co-working space in France, or from our wonderful office in the center of Paris

🏝You’ll get 10 additional days off (to the 25 standard ones) to rest and do what you love each year

🍜 You’ll have lunch credits (Swile card) to buy your favorite food every day

🏥 You’ll have a great healthcare cover (Alan Blue) to take care of yourself and your family

We're working on providing those last advantages to our people based outside of France as well, but it can be quite more complex depending on different countries. 

What does the recruitment process look like ? 

 You will first have a general chat with a Talent Acquisition Manager (30 min) You’ll then have a discussion with 1 member of our Product team to assess the fit and the Product culture (45 min) You’ll then pass a live case study with 2 PMs from our team (1h15) You'll have a final round with Tancrède (our CPO) and a Group PM or a Head of Product (60 mn)

We make sure we move fast ; you can expect the recruitment process with us to last between 15 and 25 days in total. 

Who are we looking for ?

 Strong user research skills and Product sense: ability to develop a strong conviction about user needs and problems based on user feedback (from all types of sources) Strong & structured communication skills to convince and get buy in on his/her vision, embark/drive the squad, build relationships with commercial teams, talk to users regularly.. Ability to navigate and simplify complex problems (understand, vulgarize, break problems into small pieces) Hands-on and not afraid to step out of the traditional product role to make the product succeed (working on Educational content, and enablement if needed..) Past experience in Product management at a scale up or large tech company is required (ideally a company with a strong product culture) Experience working with accounting is not required (generalist profile is ok) as long as they are curious about accounting and comfortable with complexity.

description.text:
Le PMU est une tech company spécialisée en betting & gaming (hippique, sport, poker, NFT) qui rassemble plus de 1 100 talents (dont 320 en région) passionnés, au sein d'un univers captivant, aux forts enjeux & challenges notamment technologiques.

Nos Chiffres Clés

 1er opérateur de paris hippiques en Europe et 3ème acteur mondial 10 milliards d'enjeux dont 9,3 MdsEUR d'enjeux hippiques 835 millions de contribution à la filière hippique Plus de 3,2 millions de clients (en ligne et points de vente) 14000 points de vente en France Plus de 110 partenaires dans plus de 50 pays à l'international 1,1 milliard de transactions par an, gérées par notre SI coeur de métier

Au PMU, nous partageons des valeurs fortes et sommes engagés dans une stratégie RSE qui s'appuie sur plusieurs piliers, dont une politique de jeu responsable. Nous avons à coeur de favoriser l'égalité des chances, l'accueil de personnes en situation de Handicap, la diversité et la parité.

(Pour en savoir plus, retrouvez-nous sur Welcome to the jungle et la chaine Equidia sur Youtube : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zJcsXVuvSHo)

Au sein de la Direction Marketing Produit et Ecommerce et rattaché Head of Product du Département Produit, nous recherchons notre futur(e) Senior Product Manager CIAM - Gestion de compte.

Votre Terrain De Jeu

Le produit CIAM - Gestion de compte représente l'ensemble des parcours liés à l'activité du compte permettant l'acquisition, activation, rétention et de stimuler les joueurs. Sur les points de contact existants ou via la création de nouveaux points de contact.

L'objectif étant d'augmenter la valeur et la satisfaction client.

Les Parcours Concernés Sont

 Ceux liés aux parcours de création de compte et vérification d'identité mais aussi d'authentification. (front et back) Ceux liés aux parcours de paiement (approvisionnement et retrait) Les parcours de jeu responsable clé dans un secteur très régulé

Composants

 Brique authentification (CIAM) Gestion de compte back et front Composant de paiement approvisionnement et retrait

Au Croisement Du Métier Et De La Technique Vous Serez Le Référent Et Le Chef D'orchestre Du Périmètre Pour?

 Décliner les enjeux stratégiques de l'entreprise en vision produit et la porter auprès des équipes du train?; Collecter, synthétiser les besoins des Business Owner Décliner cela en initiatives (EPICS et Features), les prioriser et les intégrer dans la roadmap produit à 9 mois, en lotissant les sujets pour proposer le plus rapidement de la valeur à nos clients partenaires et parieurs (logique de MVP)?; Intégrer dans la conception des sujets les contraintes réglementaires et les impacts dans les outils comptables et financiers du PMU?; Challenger les choix fonctionnels en fonction des feedbacks utilisateurs?; Assurer une cohérence des parcours et des développements avec le projet de refonte de l'application de prise de paris sur les bornes PMU?; Comprendre et prioriser les sujets techniques ("?Enablers?") du périmètre en collaboration avec les architectes techniques et les lead développeurs?; Concevoir, spécifier, suivre les fonctionnalités du produit selon la méthodologie SAFe et sa déclinaison au sein du PMU. C'est-à-dire participer ou animer les cérémonies du train et alimenter les outils d'entreprise (JIRA, Confluence, Miro).

Le monde du gaming et du betting vous anime ? Et si c'était vous, notre candidat idéal??

 Vous connaissez l'écosystème du compte et de l'authentification Vous disposez d'expériences significatives en Product Management Vous avez évolué dans des fonctions métiers ou êtes capable de démontrer votre capacité à intégrer rapidement des enjeux business?; Vous avez des compétences solides sur le discovery et le delivery dans un environnement agile à l'échelle ; Vous êtes capable et avez envie de gérer des produits sur un horizon long terme?; Vous êtes rigoureux(-se), curieux(-se), souple, proactif et apporteur de solutions?; Vous êtes un communiquant capable de fédérer des équipes larges (business, IT, voire Comité de Direction) autour d'un produit et d'un objectif, et savez faire preuve d'esprit de synthèse et de leadership pour porter vos sujets?; Vous savez faire preuve d'empathie, d'écoute active et avez le sens du collectif ; Vous aimez découvrir et "?aller sur le terrain?"?; Vous avez à coeur de partager vos réflexions, bonnes pratiques et enseignements à la communauté produit pour atteindre un niveau d'expertise et d'excellence global?; Vous êtes curieux des évolutions de votre métier et les suivez dans le temps ; Une connaissance de l'univers du pari hippique ou sportif est essentielle.

Ce que nous offrons?:

 Télétravail autorisé (moyenne 2 jours/semaine) Ticket Restaurant : 11,50euros dont 60% pris en charge Prise en charge à hauteur de 65% de l'abonnement de transports Un?montant forfaitaire pour un achat lié à la mobilité douce (vélo, trottinette) Epargne salariale : Intéressement, PEE, PERCOL, CET Mutuelle : gratuité pour l'adhérent Bien-être au travail : Moka care (sessions de coaching, programmes self-care : articles, audio et vidéo) Participation financière à des abonnements sur l'application Well Pass Accompagnement à la parentalité avec l'application May Santé Possibilité d'accéder au dispositif "?vis ma vie?" Dispositif " Action Logement "

Informations complémentaires?:

 Localisation?: Paris 17 Porte de Clichy (RER C, Lignes 13 et 14) Début contrat : Immédiatement Statut : Cadre

Processus de recrutement?:

 Pré-sélection avec la Team RH 1er échange avec le Manager 2ème échange avec le Responsable RH

Participez à l'aventure PMU ! " Ensemble, à nous de jouer ! "

Ce poste est ouvert aux personnes en situation de handicap. 26187265-57915
