description.text:
We provide the DevOps automation platform built to empower developers. From cloud infrastructure provisioning to production deployment, Qovery streamlines every step, enabling faster delivery, simplified workflows, and significant time savings.

🤩 Why is your role important?

As Qovery’s first Product Marketing Manager, you will lay the foundation for how our story is told to the world. You’ll shape the way we position ourselves in a crowded DevOps and cloud market, crafting messaging that cuts through the noise and resonates with both developers and business buyers. This role is pivotal in giving clarity to our narrative, enabling the sales team, and helping our users understand the real value of choosing Qovery.

🚀 What will your job look like

As our first Product Marketing Manager, you’ll be both strategist and builder. Your mission will be to:

Define positioning and messaging that makes Qovery’s value clear to developers, platform teams, and business stakeholders. Enable our sales team with the right tools (battlecards, one-pagers, pitch decks) to communicate our story with clarity and impact. Shape our go-to-market strategy for new features and product launches, ensuring we stand out in a crowded DevOps/CloudOps market. Collaborate with Product and Engineering to translate complex technology into simple, compelling narratives. Lead market research and competitive analysis to keep us ahead of industry trends and sharpen our differentiation. Support demand generation with content and campaigns that attract and educate prospects. Embody Qovery’s Culture: Collaborate in a caring, transparent, and innovative environment, building authentic relationships with customers and colleagues.

This is a role for someone who thrives in an early-stage environment: you’ll have freedom to experiment, influence strategy directly, and set the standards for Product Marketing at Qovery.

💡 About you

We’re looking for a Product Marketing Manager who is equal parts storyteller and strategist. Someone who can dive deep into our product, empathize with developers and platform teams, and translate technical complexity into messages that resonate.

Here’s What Will Help You Succeed

Experience in B2B SaaS — ideally in DevOps, Cloud, Platform Engineering, or a technical developer-focused product. A builder’s mindset — you’ve shaped Product Marketing in a growing company before, or you’re eager to take on that challenge for the first time. Strong communication skills — you can switch seamlessly between writing clear, concise copy and building narratives for executives, customers, and sales teams. Analytical and curious — you like to dig into customer insights, market research, and data to inform positioning and strategy. Collaborative by nature — you work well with Product, Engineering, Sales, and Marketing, and know how to bridge technical and commercial worlds. Hands-on and proactive — in a small team, you’re comfortable rolling up your sleeves and making things happen.

Most importantly, you share our values: ownership, transparency, and a developer-first mindset.

🎯 What You’ll Get at Qovery

Competitive Compensation.Comprehensive Benefits.Flexible Work Setup: Remote-first culture; work from anywhere with a reliable internet connection.Learning Opportunities: Professional development and growth supported from day one.Innovative Environment: Join a high-growth startup pushing boundaries in cloud technology.Authentic Culture: Collaborate with a team that values care, innovation, and customer success.

💥 Our Talent Acquisition Process

We’ve designed a streamlined process to ensure a great candidate experience. Typically, it takes 3-4 weeks:

Initial Call: Meet with Marie or Ludwig to discuss your experience, motivation, and career goals.Hiring Manager Interview: A 60-minute deep dive into your sales skills and collaboration experience.Workshop/Case Study PresentationFinal Round: Meet with a co-founder and leadership to discuss alignment with Qovery’s values and mission.Reference Checks: Validate performance, integrity, and alignment with our needs.

We’re committed to keeping you informed throughout the process, ensuring a smooth and transparent experience.

We are passionate about simplifying the complexities of cloud infrastructure for software development. We provide an Internal Developer Platform that streamlines the path to production, offering solutions like testing, ephemeral environments, and a focus on continuous software improvement.

As a growing company co-founded by experienced professionals, we are committed to innovation and excellence in the tech world.

description.text:
At Accelerant, we’re transforming the way capacity is distributed to specialist MGAs across Europe, UK, US and Canada. We help our partner MGA’s growth through high-quality capacity, strategic advice, streamlined processes, and exceptional service. We value innovation, collaboration, and a data-driven approach to create lasting success for our partners.
The RoleTo be successful in this role you will need significant experience of insurance and MGA operations/binder management. You also need to be a comfortable leader.
We are seeking a French-speaking Insurance Professional to join our growing team of experts. The Member Relationship Director lead MGA onboarding, relationship management, and operational delivery for our MGA Members across Europe. This is a high-impact role where you will be the key link between our Members, Brokers, Underwriters, and internal teams — ensuring exceptional service and strategic growth opportunities.
What You'll DoLead onboarding for new MGA Members, from due diligence to operational go-live.Manage relationships with existing MGA Members, ensuring ongoing satisfaction and growth.Identify strategic and tactical opportunities to support MGA Member success.Oversee and improve operational processes for greater efficiency.Ensure compliance with local and European regulatory standards.Act as an escalation point for operational issues, audits, and credit control matters.Coordinate with TPAs, Brokers, and Underwriters for smooth and timely information flow.
What You BringStrong knowledge and understanding of MGA operations and binder management.Experience in insuranceFluency in French and English (additional European languages are a plus).Proven experience managing MGA or delegated authority business relationships.Strong understanding of European insurance market regulations.Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.Self-starter mindset with the ability to work in a geographically diverse team.
Why Join UsBe part of a fast-growing, innovative company redefining delegated underwriting.Work alongside industry experts in an international, collaborative environment.Opportunity to shape and improve processes with measurable impact.Competitive compensation.
Enjoy our comprehensive benefits package designed to meet your diverse needs and support your well-being:
Work-life balance: We believe that taking time to rest and recharge makes us all better. That’s why we offer flexible time off and encourage our team to take the time they need to prioritize their health and well-being.
Health and wellness: We offer high-quality health, dental, and other benefits to ensureour team members have access to the care they need.
Remote work: Work where you’re most productive and fulfilled. This position is open to remote candidates across Europe who have the flexibility to work with our teams distributed across Europe and North America. Most cross-team collaboration happens in the mornings of the Eastern Time Zone.
Travel: We value face-to-face connections and believe that in-person interactions can enhance collaboration and build stronger relationships. Travel could be a small part of your role, with opportunities to connect with your team and our members in person.

About Accelerant:Accelerant is a data-driven risk exchange connecting underwriters of specialty insurance risk with risk capital providers. Accelerant was founded in 2018 by a group of longtime insurance industry executives and technology experts who shared a vision of rebuilding the way risk is exchanged – so that it works better, for everyone. The Accelerant risk exchange does business across more than 20 different countries and 250 specialty products, and we are proud that our insurers have been awarded an AM Best A- (Excellent) rating. For more information, please visit www.accelerant.ai
Ready to join us? Apply now and help us deliver exceptional service to our MGA Members across Europe.

Remote work: Work where you’re most productive and fulfilled. This position is open to remote candidates across Europe who have the flexibility to work with our teams distributed across Europe and North America. Most cross-team collaboration happens in the mornings of the Eastern Time Zone.
Travel: We value face-to-face connections and believe that in-person interactions can enhance collaboration and build stronger relationships. Travel could be a small part of your role, with opportunities to connect with your team and our members in person.

About Accelerant:Accelerant is a data-driven risk exchange connecting underwriters of specialty insurance risk with risk capital providers. Accelerant was founded in 2018 by a group of longtime insurance industry executives and technology experts who shared a vision of rebuilding the way risk is exchanged – so that it works better, for everyone. The Accelerant risk exchange does business across more than 20 different countries and 250 specialty products, and we are proud that our insurers have been awarded an AM Best A- (Excellent) rating. For more information, please visit www.accelerant.ai
Ready to join us? Apply now and help us deliver exceptional service to our MGA Members across Europe.

description.text:
Rare Opportunité Off Market pour Coach / Consultant / Formateur expérimenté à saisir aujourd’hui 

Transformation – Leadership – RH – Agilité – Changement – RSE – QVT

📍 Remote — Démarrage rapide | 🌐 Accès exclusif | 🎙️ Un seul profil sera retenu





- Pourquoi je fais cela aujourd’hui ?

Parce que cela coïncide avec une période de disponibilité pour moi, là maintenant, et que, comme souvent dans mon quotidien et surtout ces derniers jours,, des échanges informels mais stratégiques avec certains de mes homologues ( DG comme moi), des dirigeants que je connais personnellement (PDG, DG, DRH, membres de COMEX), ont fait émerger des besoins réels, sensibles, des projets à fort enjeu humain et organisationnel.
Ces dirigeants, que je connais personnellement et qui me font confiance, m’ont partagé sans filtres leurs réflexions, leurs projets de transformation, de croissance, repositionnement, leurs ambitions et leurs zones de vigilance.



Et dans ces moments-là, une phrase revient souvent :
« Tu connaîtrais quelqu’un de vraiment solide, qui comprend les enjeux et à qui je pourrais confier cela ? »

C’est pour répondre à ce type de besoin que j’ouvre aujourd’hui cette opportunité confidentielle, hors des circuits classiques, hors du bruit, hors des plateformes.

Parce que je suis disponible maintenant, et parce que vous pourriez être la bonne personne. Un accès en primeur !




- Ce que j’y gagne ? Ce vous y gagnez …

Soyons transparents.

J’agis à titre strictement personnel, parce que j’ai le réseau, la légitimité et l’écoute de dirigeants décisionnaires qui me font confiance — et que je peux vous y introduire dans les meilleures conditions.


Je n’agis pour le compte de personne, je ne suis mandatée par personne, par aucune entreprise, je ne suis ni cabinet de conseil, ni apporteur d’affaires, ni recruteur déguisé, ni chasseur de têtes.
C’est une démarche personnelle.
Je ne fonctionnes pas à la commission, ni au pourcentage au chiffre d’affaires sur futurs contrats générés, mais selon un modèle forfaitaire (Toute projection tarifaire à ce stade sans connaissance précise de votre posture, de votre positionnement, de vos objectifs, ou encore des typologies d’entreprises et des interlocuteurs que je pourrais activer pour vous, relèverait de l’approximation — sinon de l’amateurisme. Ma méthodologie repose sur une écoute fine, un calibrage rigoureux et une mise en relation sur-mesure, à forte valeur ajoutée. Cela suppose en retour une posture professionnelle exigeante, une vraie disponibilité d’esprit, et une capacité à se projeter dans une dynamique stratégique, pas dans une simple logique opportuniste ou transactionnelle).


Mais je connais la difficulté, pour un indépendant de haut niveau, de :

sortir du bruit ambiant,

accéder directement à des décideurs,

et faire reconnaître sa valeur réelle sans se brader.

Je choisis donc d’ouvrir mon réseau personnel, à un profil unique, à travers une collaboration cadrée, assumée, éthique, où chacun sait pourquoi il est là, et ce qu’il apporte.

Ce que je propose, c’est un accès direct et légitime à des décideurs, sans filtre, sans jeu de rôle, dans un contexte de rare confiance, de manière travaillée, contextualisée.

Et cela n’a pas de prix fixe, car cela n’a pas d’équivalent.


Ce que je propose donc – et ce que cela change pour vous :

Je n’agis pour le compte de personne, je ne suis ni cabinet de conseil, ni apporteur d’affaires, ni recruteur déguisé.
Je n’opère pas à la commission, ni au pourcentage sur vos futurs contrats, mais selon un modèle forfaitaire, simple, transparent et aligné sur la valeur réelle de la mise en relation.

Je mets à votre disposition :
✅ Mon réseau personnel, construit au fil d’années dans des cercles de dirigeants stratégiques
✅ Un accès direct aux décideurs, sans filtre, sans jeux d’acteurs
✅ Une contextualisation précise, qui installe la confiance dès le premier contact
✅ Une méthodologie de calibrage rigoureuse, pour éviter toute perte de temps

Mon rôle : vous introduire là où votre impact sera maximal, vous ouvrir les bonnes portes au bon moment, pour de la visibilité et opportunités où vous étiez invisibles , ou noyés dans la masse et la concurrence. Un accès en « primeur » vous évitant une file d’attente, mais plutôt un gain de temps considérable, car oui le temps est précieux nous le savons tous et toutes ! Un tremplin, des leviers ( visibilité, notoriété et prospection) pour booster votre activité et pas seulement sur une notion de ROI instantanée , du One Shot, mais booster votre activité avec une vision, uns véritable stratégie, et un développement durable, et de la RECURRENCE ! Voilà ce qui fera votre succès 




🔹 Le Contexte :

Pas de fiche de poste.
Pas d’appel d’offres.
Mais des projets déjà initiés, des intentions déjà formulées, par des dirigeants engagés dans une démarche de transformation réelle.

Ils sont :

✔️ Habitués au coaching, au conseil, à la formation
✔️ En position de décision directe
✔️ Dans une relation de confiance avec moi
✔️ En attente d’un profil solide, fiable, aligné

🔹 Expertises attendues (selon profils et contextes) :

✅ Conduite du changement & transformation organisationnelle
✅ Coaching de dirigeants, posture managériale, alignement COMEX / CODIR
✅ Stratégie RH, agilité, dynamique d’équipe
✅ RSE, QVT, intelligence collective
✅ Repositionnement stratégique post-fusion, croissance ou pivot
✅ Hauteur de vue, ancrage, finesse relationnelle


🛠️ Formes possibles : Coaching, conseil, ateliers, formation – Individuel ou collectif
🎯 C’est à vous, en tant qu’expert, de proposer le bon format , pas à l’entreprise de le prédéfinir.
Ce sont des interlocuteurs familiers de ces approches, sans résistance aux formats proposés.




🔹 Ce que je recherche (et ne recherche pas) :

Je cherche une personne capable d’incarner son expertise, sans chercher à « tester le terrain », ni troquer des services, ou « avoir avant avec un contact ou un dirigeant pour prendre la température ». On ne teste pas des PDF ou DG…



❌ Pas de posture opportuniste.
❌ Pas de discours « je verrai selon la mission ».
❌ Pas de « je veux bien en parler si c’est gratuit dans un premier temps ».



✅ Ce que j’attends :
• Réactivité. Maturité. Ancrage.
• Disponibilité réelle pour saisir une opportunité et la transformer.
• Posture claire, professionnelle, stable — apte à dialoguer avec des COMEX.
• Capacité à vous positionner rapidement, avec justesse.
• Une vision long terme, au-delà du ROI immédiat.

Nous sommes ici dans une autre sphère : celle de la valeur stratégique, de la relation directe, et du choix mutuel.



🔹 Et concrètement ?

📹 Un échange en visio (35–40 min)
📍 Objectif :
• Vérifier votre posture, votre niveau d’expertise,Votre positionnement, Vos leviers d’impact

🧭 Une décision claire à l’issue même de cet échange : de votre côté et du bien 


Cette future potentielle collaboration sera régit par une convention d’affaires ( que je transmettrais à une prochaine étape au profil retenu uniquement).





Ceci est une démarche totalement personnelle, et indépendante de mon métier principal de DG. 
Cela n’est pas une activité connexe à temps plein. Cela n’aura pas vocation à se reproduire. 
C’est une opportunité à saisir maintenant, car les opportunités et projets n’attendent pas des mois, vous en conviendrez.

Ainsi, cette opportunité bien que singulière oui et multiple (levier de visibilité, accès direct auprès dirigeants de mon carnet d’adresses, et prospection).
Non connues par cabinets, plate-forme de recrutement public, centres de formations, et donc non publiées.
C’est donc un accès en primeur et exclusivité.




📌 1 seul profil sera retenu pour cette mission confidentielle.

Les plus belles missions ne sont jamais publiées.
Elles naissent dans des cercles restreints, dans des temps opportuns, entre ceux qui savent détecter un moment juste.

Les plus belles opportunités ne se signalent pas.
Elles ne viennent pas frapper à la porte.

Elles sont à reconnaître.
Et à saisir avant que d'autres ne le fassent.


Le reste, nous le clarifierons ensemble, en face-à-face.


🎯 Si vous cherchez à gagner en visibilité stratégique, accéder directement à des décideurs, développer votre activité et durablement, et intervenir là où votre impact sera maximal, prenez contact pour un rdv des aujourd’hui !

description.text:
⭐ Senior Product Manager (Mobile)💸 Up to €100,000 + bonus📍 Fully remote
Are you an experienced Product Manager with a strong B2C background? Do you have extensive mobile experience across both iOS and Android apps? Are you interested in working for a high growth subscription-based business? If so, this could be the perfect next role for you!
This D2C subscription business has already amassed 100’s of thousands of customers and are now looking to take their mobile apps to the next level! This isn’t a maintenance role, you’ll drive innovation to deliver high quality, high retention app experiences which is a key revenue channel for the business.
What are they looking for?A pro-active, forward thinking Product Manager with a strong B2C background and deep understanding of iOS and Android capabilitiesProven track record shipping native mobile app features with measurable retention or LTV impactExperience working within subscription based businesses Customer centric with a natural flair for developing a deep understanding of their needs.Highly analytical who loves solving complex problems.Strong coaching and leadership qualities.Highly collaborative and outcome focused with excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
This is a great opportunity for a data informed decision maker and customer advocate to take on a high-profile role and work alongside an impressive Product Director.
Please send your CV now for more information on both the role and company!

description.text:
🚀 Devenez Commercial Terrain Indépendant chez SumUp – France

🎯 Vous êtes un vendeur indépendant, mobile et passionné par les relations humaines ? Rejoignez SumUp et aidez les commerçants locaux à développer leur activité grâce à des solutions de paiement innovantes.

💼 Vos missions

Prospection proactive : Identifiez et engagez des commerçants locaux, en particulier des petites entreprises, pour leur présenter les solutions de paiement SumUp. Démonstrations sur le terrain : Réalisez des démonstrations convaincantes des produits SumUp, en mettant en avant leur valeur ajoutée pour les commerçants. Gestion du cycle de vente : Accompagnez les clients tout au long du processus de vente, de la première prise de contact à la conclusion de l'accord. Développement de votre réseau : Utilisez vos connexions locales pour identifier de nouvelles opportunités et renforcer la présence de SumUp dans la région Bourgogne-Franche-Comté. 

🧠 Profil recherché

Communicateur naturel : Vous établissez facilement des relations de confiance avec les commerçants et adaptez votre discours à différents interlocuteurs. Autonome et orienté résultats : Vous êtes motivé par les objectifs et capable de gérer votre emploi du temps de manière indépendante. Esprit entrepreneurial : Vous comprenez les défis des petites entreprises et savez proposer des solutions adaptées à leurs besoins. Flexible et mobile : Vous êtes à l'aise pour vous déplacer dans votre région et adapter votre emploi du temps en fonction des opportunités. Expérience terrain : Vous avez au moins un an d'expérience en vente sur le terrain au cours des six dernières années. 

🎁 Ce que nous offrons

Commissions attractives : Un système de rémunération basé sur la performance, sans plafond de commission. Formation et accompagnement : Des ressources pour vous aider à maîtriser nos produits et à développer vos compétences commerciales. Autonomie : La liberté de gérer votre activité en tant qu'indépendant, tout en bénéficiant du soutien d'une entreprise innovante. Impact local : Contribuez au développement des petites entreprises de votre région en leur proposant des solutions de paiement adaptées. 

Veuillez s'il vous plait noter que pour postuler à ce poste en tant qu’indépendant, vous devez impérativement disposer d’un numéro SIRET valide, attestant de votre enregistrement en tant que freelance ou micro-entrepreneur.

Job Application Tip

We recognise that candidates feel they need to meet 100% of the job criteria in order to apply for a job. Please note that this is only a guide. If you don’t tick every box, it’s ok too because it means you have room to learn and develop your career at SumUp.

description.text:
About Voodoo

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

Team

Our Publishing team plays a strategic role in the company’s growth and serves as a launchpad for Voodoo’s future leaders. The team brings together top performers from consulting, finance, and tech with a passion for product, creativity, and execution.

As part of Voodoo Gaming, we partner with studios to build games from initial concept to global launch, aiming to create the next wave of iconic, chart-topping hybrid-casual hits. With over eight billion downloads and counting, Voodoo is the world’s largest and most successful hybrid-casual publisher.

Role

basic_info.title: Expert Crédit Sénior et Mentor H/F - Team Full remote

description.text:
🎯 Nous rejoindre en tant qu'Expert Crédit Sénior et Mentor chez Pretto
L'entité Full-Remote de Pretto poursuit sa croissance rapide et pour accompagner cette dynamique, nous recherchons un(e) Expert Crédit Sénior / Mentor basé en France métropolitaine. Le poste mêle une forte contribution opérationnelle (4/5ème) et un temps dédié au mentorat d'une petite équipe junior (1/5ème). L'objectif affiché est d'évoluer sur un poste de Team Lead à moyen-terme mais il est aussi possible de rester sur un poste opérationnel. 
🌟Ton rôle
- Convertir un fort volume de flux entrant très qualifié via notre simulateur- Gérer un portefeuille et générer 25% de son chiffre d'affaires via le parrainage- Accompagner les clients dans la construction de la meilleure solution de financement dans le cadre de leur projet immobilier et savoir les fidéliser- Négocier avec les banques- Contribuer à l'amélioration continuelle de nos outils et technologies au contact d'une équipe Tech/Produit de folie- Accompagner la progression opérationnelle et suivre les performances de 1 à 3 Experts Crédits 
👫 Ton profil
- Tu as une expérience en Sales significative d'au moins 4/5 ans : tu te considères expert dans le développement commercial, idéalement sur du produit complexe- Si tu as de l'XP dans le courtage en crédit immo, ce sera bien évidemment un plus, mais ce n'est pas nécessairement un pré-requis !- Tu cherches une entreprise où il y a un fort volume d'activité à gérer, tu veux des journée qui filent à 100 à l'heure et beaucoup de clients à gérer en simultané !- Tu as une expérience significative en full-remote et tu sais maintenant que c'est comme ça que tu veux bosser (et pas autrement !)- Tu as déjà formé/mentoré/coaché des commerciaux apprenants et tu prends beaucoup de plaisir à le faire- Tu es avant tout drivé par une vraie soif de commerce : tu cherches à atteindre et dépasser des objectifs ambitieux- Tu cherches à devenir un manager engagé, qui inspire par l’exemple et crée un collectif soudé autour de lui- Tu es à l’aise avec les outils (CRM, solutions métier), et tu comprends que la tech est un levier fort de performance- Tu es rigoureux(se), structuré(e), avec un excellent relationnel et une communication irréprochable (écrite comme orale) 
🔥 Rejoins la team Sales parce que :
On t’offre un accompagnement en interne avec les meilleurs standards (formation coaching, culture de l’entraide et transmission de bonnes pratiques)On te propose un plan de carrière qui te permettra de grandir chez nousLa culture du feedback : chez Pretto tout le monde a droit de donner son avis et proposer des solutions, c'est même recommandé ! 
🎁 Les avantages à travailler chez Pretto
💰 Un package salarial avantageux : carte ticket restaurant Swile, mutuelle prise en charge à 50%🌟 Des primes attractives : vacances, cooptation pouvant aller jusqu'à 2000€, intéressement, naissance🍻 Des moments partagés entre collègues : onboarding avec ta promo, rituels d’équipe, offsite...💚 Prise en charge de 4 séances/an sur moka.care👥 Un parrain ou marraine référent(e) pour te permettre de t’intégrer et de t’épanouir chez Pretto
🤝 Notre processus de recrutement
Un entretien d'une heure en visio avec Charles ou Lorane - Team Talent AcquisitionPuis un entretien en visio avec Hélène, Head of Sales du bureau Full-remote, à la suite duquel nous te demanderons de nous communiquer une prise de référenceUn dernier échange en visio avec Pierre, CEO de PrettoFélicitations, nous te rappelons pour te faire une offre 🥳Bienvenue chez nous ! 🎉

description.text:
Budget: 700

About Us

Marble is a fintech infrastructure startup, backed by VCs and Hexa.

We build a groundbreaking open-source decision engine for banks, payment service providers and marketplaces.

The Opportunity: Your Mission

As our first dedicated Product Designer, you will have a unique opportunity to shape the user experience of a powerful, data-rich platform from the ground up. Your mission is to translate the complexity of fraud detection and investigation into a simple, intuitive, and powerful interface for our users. You'll work directly with the founders to set the design vision and create a product that not only looks good but empowers financial institutions to make critical decisions with confidence.

What You'll Do

Own the end-to-end design process, from wireframes and user flows to high-fidelity mockups and interactive prototypes.Design intuitive dashboards, complex data visualizations, and streamlined workflows for new and existing features (approx. 2/3 of your time).Elevate and unify our existing product experience, focusing on improving navigation, usability, and overall UX.Build, maintain, and extend our Design System in Figma to ensure consistency and accelerate development.Collaborate closely with the CEO, CTO, and two front-end developers in a tight feedback loop, balancing user needs, technical constraints, and business goals.

Who We're Looking For: Skills & Experience

A Proven B2B/SaaS Designer: You have a strong portfolio with a proven track record of designing complex, user-facing web applications. Experience with enterprise software, analytics dashboards, or the fintech/banking sector is a significant plus.A UX Strategist: You excel at making the complex simple. You design interfaces that don't just look good but feel intuitive, and you obsess over edge cases to create a robust user experience.A Figma Pro: You are highly proficient with modern Figma practices, including auto-layout, variants, and creating scalable Design Systems.A Pragmatic Collaborator: You thrive working hand-in-hand with developers. You know how to communicate design decisions clearly, give and receive constructive feedback, and find pragmatic solutions.Detail-Oriented: You can design for a range of screen sizes (desktop-focused) and are mindful of challenges like internationalization.Team Player: You're willing to occasionally assist with visual assets for our website or blog to ensure brand consistency across all touchpoints.

How We Work At Marble

We are a small, lean team of seasoned industry experts with the ambition to remake anti-fraud from the bottom up.We plan for the long game but focus on fast value. We choose the simplest solution and iterate quickly. We compromise on feature breadth rather than security or usability.We are opinionated, but set our ego aside. We discuss, commit, execute.We are pragmatic and we execute fast on our decisions. We are perseverant when facing challenges but review plans if we hit a roadblock.We excel at our job but work beyond our field of expertise. No task is below us.We always take ownership - but also know when to share it.We value output over input. We allow for flexibility and optimize for focus time.

The Details

Engagement: Part-time freelance contract, starting at 2 days/week.Duration: 6+ months, with the potential to increase to 3+ days/week as we grow.Location: Remote, within a UTC+0 to UTC+4 time zone (approx. +-2 hours from Paris).Compensation: We offer a competitive freelance rate based on your experience. Let us know your expectations.

Organization

We are looking for a part-time position, 2 days a week, for 6 months+.Depending on team growth, we may need to increase to 3 days+/week in the medium term.We are ok for remote work for this part-time position, at +- 2 hours of Paris time.Compensation based on experience and region

Hiring Process

Portfolio Review: We'll review your application and portfolio.Introductory Chat (30 min): A call with our CTO to discuss your experience, our mission, and the role.Paid & Practical Work Assignment (~3 hours): A small, well-defined design task that reflects our daily challenges. We respect your time and expertise, so this assignment is compensated.Final Discussion & Offer.

description.text:
We’re looking for a Casino Manager for a fast-growing iGaming business. 
You'll be at the heart of the product, evaluating new game titles, curating the best mix for players, and constantly refining the content strategy through data and player behavior. Whether it’s reviewing game mechanics, analyzing hit rates, or testing themes, you’ll help define what great looks like in the casino lobby.
This is a role for someone who lives and breathes casino content — someone who wants to build structured, scalable processes while staying close to the games that make players come back.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Reviewing upcoming games and assessing their potential fit for our playersUsing data to spot trends, player favorites, and untapped opportunitiesCreating repeatable systems for content launches, tagging, and localizationWorking with Product to ensure content and features go hand in handBuilding relationships with providers to secure standout titles and exclusives

description.text:
About Remote

Remote is solving modern organizations’ biggest challenge – navigating global employment compliantly with ease. We make it possible for businesses of all sizes to recruit, pay, and manage international teams. With our core values at heart and future focused work culture, our team works tirelessly on ambitious problems, asynchronously, around the world. You can find Remoters working from 6 different continents (Antarctica left to go!) and all of our positions are fully remote.

We encourage every member of the Remote team to bring their talents, experiences and culture to the table to help us build the best-in-class HR platform.

If you are energetic, curious, motivated and ambitious, be part of our world. Apply now and define the future of work!

What you bring

A solid understanding of payment networks, the mechanics behind payments settlement andExperience working within the bounds of regulatory and compliance requirementsExperience integrating third party payment service providersDemonstrated ability to operate effectively in intense startup or scale-up environments, navigating ambiguity and driving clear outcomesStrong track record of influencing and improving company-wide business metrics through strategic product decisions.A flair for user experience design - you build things beautifully, and they delight customersExecution-oriented, ambitious, and ready to scale your career with RemoteA high agency, low ego mindsetWrites and speaks fluent EnglishIt's not required to have experience working remotely, but considered a plus


Key Responsibilities

Develop and optimize global payroll payments solutionsCollaborate with Design and Engineering to create intuitive and user-friendly payment flowsWork with product teams across Remote to ensure salary payments happen on time, every timeEnsure seamless integration with third-party payment providers.Partner with compliance and legal teams to ensure all payment features meet regulatory requirementsFunction effectively across teams, working closely with stakeholders in Operations, Risk, Tax, Legal


Practicals

You'll report to: Group Product ManagerTeam: Payments - Payroll PaymentsTeam size:Location: For this position we welcome everyone to apply, but we will prioritise applications from the following locations as we encourage our teams to diversify: EMEA, APACStart date: As soon as possible


Remote Compensation Philosophy

Remote's Total Rewards philosophy is to ensure fair, unbiased compensation and fair equity pay along with competitive benefits in all locations in which we operate. We do not agree to or encourage cheap-labor practices and therefore we ensure to pay above in-location rates. We hope to inspire other companies to support global talent-hiring and bring local wealth to developing countries.

At first glance our salary bands seem quite wide - here is some context. At Remote we have international operations and a globally distributed workforce. We use geo ranges to consider geographic pay differentials as part of our global compensation strategy to remain competitive in various markets while we hiring globally.

The base salary range for this full-time position is $45,750 - $128,650. USD. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level and location, and our job titles may span more than one career level. The actual base pay for the successful candidate in this role is dependent upon many factors such as location, transferable or job-related skills, work experience, relevant training, business needs, and market demands. The base salary range may be subject to change.

At Remote, we foster internal mobility as a key element of our culture of employee growth and development, supported by a compensation philosophy that guarantees pay equity and fairness. Therefore, all compensation changes associated with an internal move will be reviewed by the Total Rewards & People Enablement team on a case by case basis.

Application process

Interview with recruiterInterview with future managerInterview with team members (no managers present)Bar Raiser InterviewPrior employment verification check 


Remote's Total Rewards philosophy is to ensure fair, unbiased compensation and fair equity pay along with competitive benefits in all locations in which we operate. We do not agree to or encourage cheap-labor practices and therefore we ensure to pay above in-location rates. We hope to inspire other companies to support global talent-hiring and bring local wealth to developing countries.

At first glance our salary bands seem quite wide - here is some context. At Remote we have international operations and a globally distributed workforce. We use geo ranges to consider geographic pay differentials as part of our global compensation strategy to remain competitive in various markets while we hiring globally.

Our salary ranges are determined by role, level and location, and our job titles may span more than one career level. The actual base pay for the successful candidate in this role is dependent upon many factors such as location, transferable or job-related skills, work experience, relevant training, business needs, and market demands. The base salary range may be subject to change.

At Remote, we foster internal mobility as a key element of our culture of employee growth and development, supported by a compensation philosophy that guarantees pay equity and fairness. Therefore, all compensation changes associated with an internal move will be reviewed by the Total Rewards & People Enablement team on a case by case basis.

The annual salary range for this full-time position is

$45,750—$128,650 USD

Benefits

Our full benefits & perks are explained in our handbook at remote.com/r/benefits. As a global company, each country works differently, but some benefits/perks are for all Remoters:

work from anywhereflexible paid time offflexible working hours (we are async)16 weeks paid parental leavemental health support servicesstock optionslearning budgethome office budget & IT equipmentbudget for local in-person social events or co-working spaces


How You’ll Plan Your Day (and Life)

We work async at Remote which means you can plan your schedule around your life (and not around meetings). Read more at remote.com/async.

You will be empowered to take ownership and be proactive. When in doubt you will default to action instead of waiting. Your life-work balance is important and you will be encouraged to put yourself and your family first, and fit work around your needs.

If that sounds like something you want, apply now!

How To Apply

Please fill out the form below and upload your CV with a PDF format.We kindly ask you to submit your application and CV in English, as this is the standardised language we use here at Remote.If you don’t have an up to date CV but you are still interested in talking to us, please feel free to add a copy of your LinkedIn profile instead.


Not only do we encourage folks from all ethnic groups, genders, sexuality, age, abilities, disability status and any other under-represented group to apply, but we prioritize a sense of belonging. We have 4 ERGs (Women, Disability, Queer, Minorities in Tech) who meet regularly with the People team. During your interviews and beyond, we ask & encourage anybody who needs an accommodation to request one from their recruiter.

We will ask you to voluntarily tell us your pronouns at interview stage, and you will have the option to answer our anonymous demographic questionnaire when you apply below. As an equal employment opportunity employer it’s important to us that our workforce reflects people of all backgrounds, identities, and experiences and this data will help us to stay accountable. We thank you for providing this data, if you chose to.

At Remote, we embrace AI as a valuable tool while prioritizing human creativity and authenticity. We look forward to meeting candidates who balance innovation with genuine expertise and experience. To learn more about Remote's AI guidelines check see here.

Please note we accept applications on an ongoing basis.

Therefore, all compensation changes associated with an internal move will be reviewed by the Total Rewards & People Enablement team on a case by case basis.

The annual salary range for this full-time position is

$45,750—$128,650 USD

Benefits

Our full benefits & perks are explained in our handbook at remote.com/r/benefits. As a global company, each country works differently, but some benefits/perks are for all Remoters:

work from anywhereflexible paid time offflexible working hours (we are async)16 weeks paid parental leavemental health support servicesstock optionslearning budgethome office budget & IT equipmentbudget for local in-person social events or co-working spaces


How You’ll Plan Your Day (and Life)

We work async at Remote which means you can plan your schedule around your life (and not around meetings). Read more at remote.com/async.

You will be empowered to take ownership and be proactive. When in doubt you will default to action instead of waiting. Your life-work balance is important and you will be encouraged to put yourself and your family first, and fit work around your needs.

If that sounds like something you want, apply now!

How To Apply

Please fill out the form below and upload your CV with a PDF format.We kindly ask you to submit your application and CV in English, as this is the standardised language we use here at Remote.If you don’t have an up to date CV but you are still interested in talking to us, please feel free to add a copy of your LinkedIn profile instead.


Not only do we encourage folks from all ethnic groups, genders, sexuality, age, abilities, disability status and any other under-represented group to apply, but we prioritize a sense of belonging. We have 4 ERGs (Women, Disability, Queer, Minorities in Tech) who meet regularly with the People team. During your interviews and beyond, we ask & encourage anybody who needs an accommodation to request one from their recruiter.

We will ask you to voluntarily tell us your pronouns at interview stage, and you will have the option to answer our anonymous demographic questionnaire when you apply below. As an equal employment opportunity employer it’s important to us that our workforce reflects people of all backgrounds, identities, and experiences and this data will help us to stay accountable. We thank you for providing this data, if you chose to.

At Remote, we embrace AI as a valuable tool while prioritizing human creativity and authenticity. We look forward to meeting candidates who balance innovation with genuine expertise and experience. To learn more about Remote's AI guidelines check see here.

Please note we accept applications on an ongoing basis.

Description : Un groupe spécialisé dans la finance et les opérations de croissance cherche à s’associer avec un ou plusieurs profils techniques ambitieux pour co-développer des plateformes dans le secteur financier.Nous ne proposons pas un poste salarié mais une véritable aventure entrepreneuriale. L’atout : une force de frappe commerciale déjà active et un réseau qui permet d’accélérer rapidement les projets. Nous recherchons des indépendants motivés à construire des solutions concrètes, avec la possibilité de devenir des partenaires stratégiques du groupe.
Missions :Concevoir et piloter le développement de plateformes financières innovantes.Définir l’architecture technique et choisir les technologies adaptées.Collaborer étroitement avec l’équipe business pour aligner tech & croissance.Participer activement à la stratégie produit et à l’évolution des projets.Recruter et encadrer, à terme, une équipe technique.
Profil recherché :Expérience solide en développement et en architecture (SaaS, fintech, data, IA).Esprit entrepreneurial et envie de co-construire une vision ambitieuse.Capacité à travailler en autonomie et à prendre des décisions stratégiques.Goût du challenge et vision long terme.
Pourquoi rejoindre cette aventure ?Vous associer à un groupe déjà structuré, avec une capacité commerciale éprouvée.Construire des plateformes financières ambitieuses sans dépendre d’une levée de fonds externe.Créer de la valeur entrepreneuriale concrète dans un environnement stimulant.Développer vos compétences et votre trajectoire en tant qu’entrepreneur tech.

description.text:
With over 30,000 customers, including a third of Fortune 500 companies, Tempo is trusted by organizations across the globe to make their workflows work better.

We create a suite of integrated solutions for time management, resource planning, budget management, roadmapping, program management, reporting and more. We create the tech that enables the modern team to deliver – for every step from first vision to value.

Since our beginning in 2007 as a project to make a time-tracking tool to help a client – Tempo has expanded to become the #1 time management add-on for Jira, and we have developed and acquired a multitude of tools to become one of the most trusted names in the Atlassian ecosystem.

We want everyone to work better – but we also want to be a tech company with a heart. Join us as we continuously innovate our award-winning products, create new solutions, and help the world work smarter, not harder.

About The Role

As an Enterprise Customer Success Manager at Tempo, you’ll be a strategic partner to our largest customers, helping them drive value from our SaaS products that work together as part of an integrated suite of solutions.

In this role, you’ll own direct customer relationships, leading them through adoption and renewal. You’ll work closely with leaders on strategic planning, prioritization, and execution alignment—while also engaging users to ensure effective usage and measurable outcomes. You'll be accountable for commercial performance, including Gross Revenue Retention (GRR) and Net Revenue Retention (NRR), and play a key role in identifying success stories and expansion opportunities.

This is a high-impact role for someone who can move comfortably between executive-level discussions and product-focused adoption work, thrives in fast-changing environments, and has a strong sense of ownership and urgency.

What You’ll Do

Own the post-sale customer lifecycle across a portfolio of enterprise accounts.Lead strategic conversations with stakeholders around planning, prioritization, and value realization using Tempo’s integrated suite of SaaS products aligned to customer success criteria.Drive GRR and NRR by managing renewals, surfacing expansion opportunities, and proactively mitigating risks.Facilitate regular business reviews and outcome-focused success planning sessions directly with customer champions and decision makers .Work closely with operational users—such as project and program managers, Jira admins, and agile team leads—to guide adoption and remove friction points in the user base.Deliver best practices aligned to personas, industry and desired future states in portfolio, project and resource management workflows.Accurately forecast renewals and lead commercial discussions in partnership with Sales.Document customer goals, usage trends, risks, and outcomes with discipline and clarity on a continuous basis.Collaborate with Product and Sales to ensure a seamless and unified customer experience.Identify and help craft customer stories and case studies with the goal of highlighting their successes and raising awareness of our solutions.

Who You Are

5+ years SaaS Customer Success or Account Manager with experience managing enterprise customers and owning commercial outcomes.Strong communicator with the ability to persistently and continuously engage both senior business leaders and technical or operational users.Comfortable leading success planning, executive reviews, and renewal negotiations.Knowledge of key personas such as Project/Product/Program Managers, Agile Coaches, Jira Admins, and PMO leaders.Highly organized, proactive, and motivated by customer outcomes and long-term value creation.Embraces change and thrives in a fast-scaling, cross-functional environment.

Why Join Tempo?

Impact: Work on meaningful products that empower enterprise users and improve productivity.Innovation: Be part of a culture that values creativity and innovation, with opportunities to make a real impact.Collaboration: Join a supportive, collaborative UX team that values openness, communication, and a continuous learning environment.Growth: Opportunities for professional development, including conferences, courses, and mentorship.

What's In It For You (Org-wide) -

Remote First work environmentUnlimited vacation in most of our locations!!Great benefits including health, dental, vision and savings plan.Perks such as training reimbursement, WFH reimbursement, and more.Diverse and dynamic teams with challenging and exciting work.An opportunity to have a real impact on our business.A great range of social activities (both in person and virtual).Optional in person meet-ups and the ability to travel to our international officesEmployee referral programAnd so much more!

Note: As our hiring teams are global, please submit your resume in English only

Apply today to join the Tempo team and help shape the future of enterprise productivity software.

Join us at Tempo Software, where we proudly foster an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to creating an inclusive culture where all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

description.text:
Dans le cadre de notre croissance digitale, nous faisons évoluer deux plateformes essentielles :

Un outil développé avec Laravel, au cœur de nos opérations internes (PIM, logistique, BI, etc.) Notre site e-commerce propulsé par Magento 2, qui centralise toute notre activité en ligne. 

Pour nous accompagner, nous recherchons un(e) Product Owner passionné(e) et rigoureux(se), capable de piloter leur évolution en lien avec les équipes métiers et les prestataires techniques.

Rattaché(e) au Directeur SI, votre rôle sera essentiel pour assurer la maintenance et le développement de nos plateformes digitales. Vous accompagnerez également nos équipes opérationnelles afin d’optimiser l’utilisation de ces outils et garantir une expérience utilisateur de qualité.

Vos Responsabilités

Piloter l’évolution fonctionnelle des plateformes Laravel et Magento 2, en lien avec les équipes internes (opérations, logistique, marketing) Recueillir, prioriser et formaliser les besoins utilisateurs (bugs, améliorations, nouvelles fonctionnalités) Rédiger les user stories et suivre leur mise en œuvre jusqu’à la mise en production Être l’interface entre les utilisateurs, les développeurs et les prestataires externes Offrir un support réactif et efficace aux utilisateurs des plateformes Contribuer à la vision produit et à la structuration de la roadmap digitale Veiller à la cohérence globale des parcours utilisateurs (front et back) 

Diplômé(e) d’une formation supérieure en informatique, vous avez une première expérience significative dans un poste similaire.

Vous êtes passionné(e) par l’e-commerce et désireux(se) de vous épanouir dans un poste polyvalent où votre expertise technique et votre culture web seront des atouts majeurs.

Rigoureux(se), organisé(e), réactif(ve), et doté(e) d’un excellent sens rédactionnel, vous appréciez la diversité des missions.

Créatif(ve) et dynamique, vous êtes connu(e) pour votre sourire et votre enthousiasme communicatif. Vous aimez partager, échanger… et déguster de bons plats !

Enfin, vous avez une bonne compréhension des logiques techniques du framework Laravel et de la plateforme e-commerce Magento 2, et savez dialoguer avec des développeurs et comprendre les enjeux liés à l’architecture web.

Ce Que Nous Vous Proposons

Un cadre de travail stimulant où votre créativité et vos idées sont valorisées. Un poste en full présentiel au sein d’une équipe de passionnés, dans une ambiance conviviale et chaleureuse, avec de vrais moments de partage autour de notre amour du bien-manger Et un déjeuner offert chaque jour pour découvrir et apprécier nos recettes !

description.text:
Role DescriptionThis is a full-time remote role for a Technical Product Manager. The Technical Product Manager will be responsible for managing the product lifecycle, developing product strategies, gathering and prioritizing product requirements, and working closely with engineering, sales, marketing, and support teams. products meet company goals and customer needs.
Responsibilities ✨ Drive product vision, strategy & roadmap ✨ Define and manage product requirements across the lifecycle ✨ Collaborate with engineering teams to deliver world-class solutions ✨ Engage with clients (wallets, exchanges, asset managers) to gather feedback and improve onboarding ✨ Track performance metrics & optimize product features ✨ Stay ahead of crypto trends to shape future innovations
Qualifications
 🔹 2+ years in product management (not project/PO) 🔹 Experience or strong passion for the crypto industry (DeFi, validators, staking, etc.) 🔹 Technical background (backend, APIs) & ability to collaborate with engineers 🔹 Strong communication & analytical skills 🔹 Product-driven mindset with empathy for B2B & retail users 🔹 Thrives in fast-paced startup/scaleup environments

description.text:
💻 Job Title: AI Lead🤑 Salary: up to ~€200k (flex for the right candidate)📈 Equity: up to 0.5% (valued at $625k)📍 Location: fully remote anywhere in Europe (quarterly team get togethers)🔐 Company: Cyber Security SaaS start-up building AI agents to identify and resolve cloud vulnerabilities👥 Team: ~20 (aiming for 35+ by year end)💸 Funding: $30m+ Series A
Are you looking for the next big thing and want to work on novel products? 🚀
👉 If you’ve led AI research, built prototypes that turned into products and want to architect the future of intelligent security, this could be your defining role at a well-funded start-up, operating at the intersection of AI and cybersecurity.
We’re searching for an AI leader to set the vision, shape the research agenda and turn cutting-edge ideas into real-world impact. Working closely with the CTO, you'll own the end-to-end AI strategy, drive innovation with LLMs and agent systems, guide a growing team of top talent and translate research into breakthrough product capabilities that protect organisations worldwide.
This role is for someone who thrives at combining deep technical expertise with strategic leadership, and is eager to define the standards of how AI transforms security.
🫵 What you'll do:Define the AI vision: Develop and own the long-term strategy for applying machine learning and generative models to solve complex security problems.Turn research into products: Build prototypes of new techniques, validate them and work with engineering to transform them into customer-facing features.Establish evaluation standards: Design systems and benchmarks that measure the performance of LLMs, agents and AI-driven workflows in real-world security contexts.Raise the technical bar: Provide architectural guidance, review implementations, and ensure quality across all AI-related initiatives.Build and grow the team: Hire, mentor and lead AI talent, fostering a culture of innovation and excellence.
✅ Must have requirements:Deep LLM, NLP, GenAI and Agentic AI expertise - you must have hands-on experience with modern transformer architectures, autonomous agent systems, fine-tuning techniques, evaluations and agent frameworksA track record of guiding teams and shaping AI direction at leading research labs, major tech companies or fast-moving startups (think DeepMind, OpenAI, Anthropic, Microsoft, Google or similar)Ability to move quickly from research phase to working prototypes to scalable production systems.Experience applying AI research to practical business challenges and measuring success through user and market impact.Strong engineering foundation with a software development background (ideally in Python) and the ability to design, review and critique complex architectures.Security consciousness - understanding of vulnerability management
👍 Bonus points for:Cybersecurity domain knowledge or experience applying AI to security challengesAdvanced academic credentials (PhD or equivalent) with publications in respected conferences/journals.Familiarity with AI safety, benchmarking, and responsible deployment practices.
